Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stevedyson
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a short walk (8-10 mins) from Pasteur metro and we found it easily on the map. The check in was good and the receptionist was very friendly, spoke good English and provided my 7 year old with a TRex model to make a paint (nice touch). My son also appreciated the Xbox in reception which was provided free of charge. The room was clean and had enough room for the 3 of us. Free wifi is a bonus and you need to ask reception for the codes. We didn't have the breakfast as we prefer to get out early and grab a croissant and coffee on the road. The breakfast was Euro16.50 for adults and free for kids and looked reasonable value for money. We ate in the restaurant one evening and the food was very good especially when accompanied by a very nice bottle of Margaux! The hotel is close to the Eiffel tower and as the metro is nearby a 3 day pass meant we saw all the sites. Would recommend the hotel for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “good !!”
Reviews.Author: No_Belgian
Reviews.Content: ok, it's part of a chain, so rooms and so-on look more or less all alike...so what : Novotel has a very good price/quality : good rooms & bathrooms, free & fast wireless and very nice breakfast buffet. When it comes to this hotel, a special credit to the very helpful and friendly staff !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jolene069 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff were lovely and spoke very good english. The bed was very comfortable. We had a problem with our booking (Agent's fault) when we checked in so the hotel provided us with free cocktails to drink whilst the problem was sorted out and then sent a free bottle of champagne to our room! The only negative was that it was really rather hot in the hotel (even in February) and we couldnt seem to change this in the room so had to sleep with the window open. Other than that, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall. 8 min walk to metro.”
Reviews.Author: Kamillak
Reviews.Content: Overall very good. I would recommend this to both family and friends. But you need to walk afew hundred metres to metro to get around town.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Good location but beware of sticky finger house keeping”
Reviews.Author: Drew_AJF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, close to metro and walking distance from restaurants but the hotel staff(house keeping) is very shady. I'm positive they took my passport. My passport was in my room then all of a sudden it was gone. Then the hotel calls me 2-3 months later saying they have my passport and they found it in the safe. That couldn't have been because I never accessed the safe the whole time I was there. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again only because of house keeping and there sticky fingers. If you choose to stay at this hotel make sure you lock your things up once you leave the room for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Spot with good access to Metro”
Reviews.Author: Thommo56
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 nights over 2 breaks here in December 11, was a bit of a challange to find it after getting off the TGV.. but asked at the IBIS hotel desk and was just up around the corner..Hotel is surrounded by local eateries which we found very good, access to the Metro, Pasteur is approx 5 min walk and Beinvenue Montparnasse about 10min walk... We walked to the Eiffel Tower and Des Invalides from here, which is approx 2klms, if you like walking then there is plenty of interesting streets to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for my trip”
Reviews.Author: Kev1n_B
Reviews.Content: I wanted a reasonably priced hotel, within good distance of the Metro, a comfortable bed in a clean room, wifi included and in a relatively quiet street. I could not have asked for more! The staff were very helpful and forgiving of my broken French, I had no external noise in my room - either from outside or the corridor (and the lifts were right by the room), the free water was welcome, I was spoilt for public transport choices and the wifi was a boon / essential for researching what to do the following day. I saw the places where the rest of my family were staying, and yes they were more central, but the hotels and rooms were not as nice, not as large, had very unfriendly staff and were far more expensive: 20 mins and €1.27 carnet ticket later and I was happy bunny. I am not a big breakfast person so Gare Montparnasse was handy - Paul's "L'Express" package for €2.60 did the job but there were plenty of other choices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with average staff”
Reviews.Author: BKQ_1
Reviews.Content: Location is fine and rooms are clean and well-sized by Parisian standards. Let downs: Some of the staffs can be not so cooperative. In some rooms, life/elevator noises can be heard rather loudly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: lhacken986
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and it was great. The rooms are small, but they are clean and comfortable. The hotel is close to a few different metro stops. They allowed us to check in early since our flight arrived an hour early which was great! They also had great internet and bar and restaurant services. The area is more business buildings, but there are some little cafe's near by as well. Great view of the Eiffel Tower on the main road off of the hotel. The staff was very friendly and they were glad to give us advice and directions for our stay in Paris. I would definitely stay here again, and hope to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel to stay whilst in paris with no major issues/problems apart from location”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Aussie21
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel thinking it was next to a big train station because we were coming from london to paris via train. I thought we were arriving to the right station but then a couple of days before going to the hotel, i realised that we were arriving at gare de nord and the big train station next to the hotel was Gare Montparnasse train station. So if your coming in by train or plane or what so, remember to plan it right although if arriving near Gare Montparnasse then it should be alright. Ok so we arrived at Gare Nord and luckily the train line we were catching went to Gare Montparnasse subway station so we caught that. although upon arriving and not having GPS or google map, it was hard to find which was to go, luckily i did some print outs of how to get to the hotel. From the subway station to the hotel, you need to walk a good 20 minutes and you walk around Gare Montparnasse train station to the back (not sure if you can go through the station but you should i think) and then you get to the hotel. Arrived at the hotel and because it was late, we had to use the intercom to get in and they asked our names and we got in, interesting and i guess i was pleased by some form of security by the hotel. so we checked in and got our room keys and was streamless. We also got free wifi which was cool too. Got to our room and then realised whilst I requested a high floor, i should have asked a room facing the eiffel tower coz that would have been cool but we were facing the train tracks which was ok i guess but anyway. The room itself is spacious, just have a look at the photos. An interesting thing to note was that the toilet was by itself and not within the bathroom so after you do your business, you would need to go to the bathroom to wash your hands. The bed was comfy although the pillows were smaller than usual and they kinda were squarish but was suffice. The bathroom is new and the shower section was small but good water pressure. The hotel is close to the eiffel tower and whilst we only stayed 2 nights, on our day out, we managed to walk to the eiffel tower although it was probably a good hour walk i think. Overall no issues with this hotel apart from maybe the location but its within paris so its all good. If i come back to Paris, i wouldn't mind staying at this hotel but of course i'd try somewhere new just to try something different.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Us”
Reviews.Author: Courtney G
Reviews.Content: We love to walk, so the location was fine for us- probably 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and 10 minutes or less to restaurants. It is also less than 10 minutes of a walk to the metro. We loved the soaking tub in the bathroom. My only complaint is that the wi-fi didn't work very well in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Confused staff and a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0nGenie
Reviews.Content: Just come back from Paris, 2 nights at this hotel. Booked by mistake as I meant to book the Concorde which is the same rating and miles better. We were 3 sharing a room and it was terribly crowded. You could open the bathroom door from bed. Seperate bathroom and shower which we thought was great at first until we discovered there was no wash basin in the toilet :-S. There was a long queue at breakfast every morning with a 15-20minute or longer wait. We were told breakfast was from 7-9:30am. On the last morning we got to breakfast about 8:30, we got a table at 9, the staff made a remark that breakfast was over around 9:15 and the bacon,sausuages and many other items were not replenished. At 9:30 or soon after a number of people were coming to breakfast. A terrible argument broke out and the manager was called as the staff refused to let people in to breakfast but there were told breakfast ended at 11. Lots of confusion at this place. Staff dont seem to know whats going on. Other points: Dont attempt to take the train to the hotel at night unless you know exactly where you are going as it can be quite confusing from the train station. Get a tourist travel card for the trains and buses is you stay longer than 2 days and write the details on the card holder. It makes using the public transport easier Check online for information about museums as I have noticed on numerous occassions that they seem to close at random. The Louvre was closed on Tuesday for no reason leaving many peoples plans ruined. Always check weather conditions when going to the Eiffel tower as the lift to the top closes if the wind is too strong so you can only get as far as the second floor (still worth going to). All the information about the creation of the Eiffel Tower is on the first floor so dont skip this on your way down. Close (ish) to this hotel on Maine Street (behind the Gare Montparnasse station from hotel) is a tiny bistro, think its called St George, its next to a Chinese resturant. Prices are much lower and food is great, mostly locals.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I go to France alone for business and stay for 2 days to discover paris , I choose Novotel for the reason the lacation of hotel is near the Ifle Tower .but its not really near as I thought . Anyway , Room ,Cleaning , Warn Welcome , Reception and breakfast is more important for me . I pleased to stay there very much If I have a chance I will choose Novotel again becuase I think they keep standard in every country.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MinalC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was specious and well located. But the only problem you face any France is language barrier which luckily was not much in Novotel Gare Montparnasse. The staf was prompt and helpful especially considering ours was a group tour with people form all the age group were part of it. Room was specious, neat and clean. The hotel had games area for children. Wi-fi zone made lif eeasy since you don't feel the physical distance then. Overall w could enjoy Eifell Tower and Paris due to an excellent stay at Novotel Gare Montparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Paris, you can take the CAR AIR FRANCE from CDG airport to MONTPARNASSE(line 4). And then, you can reach to the hotel passing through the train station. It is really nice when it rains too. And you have plenty of bus going to the CHAMPS ELYSEES, department stores of GALERIES LAFAYETTE or PRINTEMPS too.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for families”
Reviews.Author: ckaye1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Gare Montparnasse with our two small children (6 and 3) and found it to be an excellent choice for family needs. The room was adequate in size and very quiet with a good, clean bathroom. Breakfast was good and was even held in a separate room for families during our stay where there was ballon modelling and magic to entertain the kids (I believe this is in holiday periods only). Staff were extremely friendly and made the children very welcome. Close enough to the metro for little legs to handle. The only downsides I would mention are that we were unfortunate they did not have a room available with a sofa bed that split into two for the kids. Not ideal. Also, the 'indoor play area' Novotel advertise on their website is just an xbox in reception so no good for smaller children.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel. It is located beside the train station for subway, commuter train and large rains. The hotel is located 10 minute walk to many restaurants located near the gallarie Lafayette.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Paris for 10 days we stayed one night at Gare Montparnasse as we were catching the train from there the next morning to Tours. The Hotel is in close proximity to the station. It seemed to have a selection of restaurants nearby but the area itself seemed a little dodgy. Therefore we ate on the champs elysees. However, the room in our hotel was very nice. The view wasn't great as we were at the end of a corridor which went out onto a loading bay but at least we couldn't hear much noise. The rooms included everything that could be expected for the price we were paying and the bathroom was nice and clean, as was the rest of the room. Would recommend slghtly more storage space but otherwise the room was expceiptional. The breakfast buffet was fantastic. There was a wide range of western and french foods and most of it tasted great. Whilst the breakfast is relatively expensive, it is very good quality, range and amount. The buffet was probably the best thing about the hotel. The hotel also had a small gym that didnt look great considerign the size of the hotel as it hardly had any equipment. There was also some computers (didnt use them as had free wirseless for two mobile devices) and an xbox for children to play with near reception. Stafff were helpful and kind. Checkout was a little bit slow but completely normal for a big hotel. Overall would be willing to stay there again if i needed to stay a night near the station for an early train the next morning. However, much nicer and much better situated places can be found elsewhere throughout paris.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to be out of the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: lmullins5702
Reviews.Content: My two teenage children and I spent 2 nights in early October 2011 and were very happy to have comfortable beds and facilities after a long flight from Oz. Sure, the rooms could be larger, but they were adequate for our requirements. Kids loved the free breakfasts, and filled themselves with a wide choice of foods and juices. Staff were respectful and friendly. Situated in a more commercial area than residential or tourist, it was quiet at nights, reasonable bistros within a few minutes walking, and reasonably easy to get to from the trains, however there are three Montparnasse stations, and one must understand the Metro station is a bit of a hike if you have backpacks or large suitcases. Having said that, it is all part of the adventure of travel in a foreign country to explore, and find, the services you are looking for. All in all, happy with the hotel, and would recommend it if you don't want an expensive or 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4star hotel? Average”
Reviews.Author: briefcasetravel
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel and was disappointed. To put things in perspective I'm use to staying in both hostels and 5 star hotels, you usually get what you pay for in my experience. However, this hotel does definitely not live up to its four star categorization. Firstly the room was smaller than the 3star I stayed in the night before. The only difference between this hotel room and the 3star was the tiny bottles of shampoo/conditioner and shower gel (which smelled amazing) and the rather cheap plastic kettle in the room. Not exactly what I was expecting, but I just shrugged it off. If you get the elevator to 7th floor the view of the Tour Eiffel is spectacular at night. The second thing that I thought was quiet odd for a four star was the fact that the room obviously was not properly cleaned during our stay. We were only there for three nights so I suppose some people wouldn't think this was too bad, but after spilling some tea on a bed sheet the first night it was easy to determine that even that sheet wasn't changed. Thirdly, which for me was the most important, was the service. Most people that I mentioned it too when I returned just rolled their eyes and said "They're French." I really disagree with this stereotype as we found the people on the street to be very helpful and polite. I purposely choose to stay in a hotel with a four star rating as I was paying for the service more than anything else. I had never been to this part of Paris before and felt I would get more assistance in a four star hotel than a cheaper option. With this in mind, I did ask the people at reception 2 questions, one about the closest metro stop, one about taxi's to the airport/Paris Nord train station. Both times I was met with an attitude of indifference and I was made feel like I had no business asking them questions like this as it's "not their job". Emphasis on 'I was made feel like', nobody actually said this too me. I know I'm probably comparing it to my 5star experiences at bit, but I honestly feel that the service in the 3 star hotels was much more welcoming and helpful. I felt I had to write this review as the positive reviews listed here did definitely not reflect my experience. It's an OK hotel, don't pay four star prices for it. Oh just to add to the metro info if you do decide to stay here, Vaugirard is right outside the hotel (2mins down the road) might save you an unpleasant interaction with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there three days for business, we booked an executive room. The Room was average in size but it had a great terrace, a pity they did not clean it. There was trash in the bin on the terrace when we arrived, it was still there when we left three days later. As usual lately in novotels, not enough water to take a decent shower… The room was new, clean, quiet and with good amenities (But I had to plug in and fix the light of the mini-bar myself on arrival). Good location on a side street 10 minutes walk from the Metro, train station, department stores and restaurants. The Staff was rather incompetent and rude during the check-in but it was very efficient, kind and friendly at checkout. It’s ok for a business trip, rather expensive after all, but I think you pay for the location... I don’t know if we’ll be back or if we could find something better around, nothing wrong with the hotel per se, but we left not entirely satisfied with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GioVale20
Reviews.Content: We (a party of three) stayed for two nights over a weekend at the Novotel Paris Gare Montparnasse. Upon arrival we walked from the Montparnasse metro station and it was quite a hike (15 minutes). We later found out that Pasteur station is closer (5-10 minutes). The hotel is located on a very quiet street and is very modern. Check-in went smooth and we were given a room even if it was only noon. The room itself was not very spacious but was very modern and clean with bath/shower and separate toilet The highlight of the stay was the breakfast which is served in the restaurant. It was the best breakfast we ever had in French hotels and included fresh pastries, crepes, waffles, juices, jams, eggs, etc. It was enough for the whole day. All in all a very good experience with great price-quality ratio. We will be back any time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: fanchfam
Reviews.Content: Loved the modern decor and the large tub for soaking my tired feet after a long day of sight seeing. The bed is firm and very comfortable. Breakfast buffet was the best we had during our 10 day trip through France (cheese, crepes, yogurt, juices, fruit, bread, etc...) The hotel smells lovely, and I was always glad to return at the end of the day. The elevators are tricky to use and take a few tries of putting your key in and out to get the thing to move. Closest Metro station is about a 15 min walk to Pasteur which connects to the 6 to take you all through Paris, and the 12 which goes straight to Montmarte. 20 min walk to the Montparnasse tower which gives great views of the city, dining, and a large Monoprix shop. Bring a good pair of walking shoes because this place is a little set apart from the closest shopping/dining etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the view”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneRivkah Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is really convenient for anyone travelling in or out of Paris from Montparnasse, as I often do. The access from the station is easy (once you get the hang of it). The views from the rooms are grim, but the rooms are comfortable, the beds are good, and the staff are helpful - and the last three are more important for me than the views.. Free wifi is a bonus, too. I like the location because it's in easy access of lots of places I do want to go to - a pleasant 10 minute stroll from St Germain, for example.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service/spacious rooms/great location - highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJussa
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. I traveled with my parents so we had a triple room. Queen size bed with a pull out couch.. very comfortable and spacious. Washroom entailed a shower/tub and sink with a separate toilet. Upon check in, you are provided with 2 WIFI passwords :) There are 2 computers in the lobby for your use (and they are free)... a printer is attached to one of them to help you print out boarding passes etc. Location was fantastic. Within 10 minutes walking distance, you had 2 Metro stations (Gare Montparnasse - main metro and train station) and Metro Pasteur. Within 5 - 10 minutes on the Metro you were at Concord/Louvre/all major tourist attractions. For the city tour buses, you can walk 10 minutes to Rue de Montparnasse and catch the Yellow line and travel one stop to the main line. Rue de Montparnasse which is approx 10 - 15 minutes walk from the hotel, is the main restaurant strip. You will also find little shops/cafes/pharmacies/grocery stores. The hotel is approx 45 minute drive from CDG... we used a car service. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte1512
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 2 nights at this hotel. The hotel may not be located in the most beautiful spot (next to the Gare Montparnasse), but if you walk 100-150m down the road you come to all the restaurants and bars you could wish for. You have 4 supermarkets close by as well if you need anything special. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very helpful and pleasant. We had a room on the 4th floor which was nice and spotlessly clean. We didn't have the greatest view, but then again I didn't book the room for that. It was great to have free WIFI which is something you hardly ever get in a hotel these days. The only negative thing about the room was the hairdryer. It became extremely hot after a short time so I needed to wrap a towel round it to use it. Why do hotels use these old fashioned hairdryers?? Maybe some people steal them if they are not screwed to the wall, but surely there are alternatives to the ones at the Novotel. But that is the only negative point to our stay, and we will most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected too much..”
Reviews.Author: Odessy12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night. Too be honest, I would rather stay somewhere else like holiday inn as rooms are a lot better, cleaner and breakfast are equally as good. Pros: Parking discount €18 for 1 night, friendly staff, free wifi, good breakfast Cons: Far from everything, room stinks - smells like a wet dog, very tiny fridge - I think it's only about 1 ft high, cheap toilet ( when you shower, everything gets wet, well we were assigned a disabled room, with holiday inn, we pay average of £80 ( £140 in novotel ) the room is excellent, toilet has a bath as well, excellent breakfast, free parking. The bed in novotel is rubbish, it's too small for 2 people and my partner's feet ( he is 5'11 tall ) are hanging out of the bed. Not a relaxing night at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for families”
Reviews.Author: VancouverKoukla
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for our family. Well located, exceptionally clean, with great service and of course large delicious breakfasts to start one's day. We recommend it with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and modern look!”
Reviews.Author: TRANMA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location about 5mins walk from the Gare Montparnasse. It offers wireless and it's clean with a modern look. The breakfast is unbelievable, great choices of food and very tasty but the negative thing is that they don't open on time (6:30am) so if you are in a rush to catch an early flight or bus, you might not be able to eat before you leave. But all in all great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fab!bright!clean!family friendly!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: julieayanna
Reviews.Content: enjoyed staying at this hotel with family and friends,the hotel is bright clean and spacious, free wifi kids can play games in reception area,staff are very helpful, short walk to Eiffel tower ,definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round choice”
Reviews.Author: Batters22
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after reading numerous reviews here, and it turned out an excellent choice. Room was large, enough space even with a fold out bed for our daughter. Nice modern bathroom with bath and shower and separate WC. Fridge in the room which was good given the temperature.... Also a safe. Although not mentioned elsewhere there was also air conditioning. Had a slight problem with the shower not draining properly but this was fixed the day we reported it. Staff were very friendly and all spoke English. The hotel is about five minutes walk from Gare Montparnasse from which there's easy access to anywhere on the metro - about 20mins or so journey into central Paris, plus you can also get the SNCF out to Versailles. There's a couple of restaurants very near the hotel and lots more nearer the front of the station. Also a convenience store just round the corner. Finally, my daughter left her MP3 player in the room, which was mailed on to us promptly free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for all reasons”
Reviews.Author: michcolon Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with our two children (ages 5&8). The hotel room was very clean and reasonably sized. The children slept on a sofa bed which folded out to two single beds. The hotel is well positioned for trains arriving/leaving Gare Montparnasse and caters very well for the children with kids entertainment for the breakfasts - although I think the breakfast is pretty overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Familyman98
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after 2 days at Eurodisney. We have one young child. We had paid £130 on the Accor website which I didn't realise included a free boat trip on the Siene a nice surprise. The girl on reception was very polite gave my little one a few free toys. The room was modern and clean. The location was good next to a main train station and a 5 minute walk to the Metro from where you can get a train direct to the Eiffel tower and with a metro map in hand you can get anywhere from this station. The staff in general were very polite, friendly and helpful They had a childrens entertainer at breakfast time a nice bonus to keeps the kids entertained The few negatives the breakfast was very limited in choice but adequate, no after hours room service :-(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent =]”
Reviews.Author: Prashiiiii
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent stay with my girlfriend. I appreciated the hotel being a half an hour walk from Eiffel Tower. On the first day this half an hour walk turned into a all day trip as we kept on getting lost and finding new and interesting landmarks. The room was a bit small but I appreciated how the toilet and shower were separate. I thought €99 for breakfast four times for two people was pretty good. It was very nice how Internet and video games were easily accessible in the lobby. I didn't use the machines, because why would you while you're in Paris. I had a problem with the lights in my room (the hotel was not at fault whatsoever, I was stupid), so I rang the reception and the lady didn't understand what 'lights' meant so she sent the manager up to the room to see what the problem was. This was a nice of them. The staff were nice. I had ordered a taxi to take my girlfriend and I to the airport for our flight the next morning but it wasn't there at our requested time or 5 minutes later, so we just walked around the corner and hailed one. I am happy the taxi didn't come because the street we were waiting to hail a taxi on gave us a fantastic view of Eiffel Tower. I have given the value a 3/5 because a similar hotel room in Krakow costs half as much, I would have rated the value even lower if it wasn't for the fact I was in Paris. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClaireJessica
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel Gare Montparnasse for a night in May. The stay was for business – a colleague and I had just arrived after a long flight from Australia so we wanted to get as good a rest as possible. Unfortunately we arrived very early in the morning and our rooms were not ready, but the staff were very accommodating – they stored our bags and managed to have adjoining rooms ready for us well before normal check-in time. The rooms were clean and comfortable, had plenty of space for storage and were well suited to the needs of business travellers. We used the room service for dinner and were a little disappointed though – the food was rather expensive for what you got. The location was perfect for us (as our train was departing from right next door!) but as a base for exploring and sightseeing, it is a little out of the way and quite difficult to find. The prices were very reasonable though.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: TarjeiJ
Reviews.Content: Very nice and central hotel not far from the Eiffel Tower and close to many good restaurants. Bath room is separated from the toilet, and each of them are incredibly small. Thumb up for having both a bath tub and a shower in the bathroom though! I noted the cleanliness of the room once I entered, nice smell in the hall and great breakfast with a variety of different foods. I had no problems whatsoever with the staff. they all seemed friendly and helpful to me. I do agree that the entrance door should be fixed though, it's very fast moving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Novotel at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: PvLAchterveld
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a suite on the top floor with balcony, separate bedroom etc which was of course all very nice. The only disadvantage was the smell in the room (as if it had not been used a long time and had recently been cleaned a bit too extensively). Breakfast was a bit of a bummer the next morning: there was a long queue to get into the breakfast room, so I decided to walk to my appointment and have a nice coffee and croissant at a local bakery for a fractional amount. For Paris, price is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “We hated it and will be miles away from this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathon999
Reviews.Content: I dont know where to start! The hotel was TERRIBLE. Utterly terrible! The round entrance gate was a death trap - it was so fast moving that one have to literally run inside it and out of it. I saw 3 people got trapped in our 3 day stay there. There was NO money exchange in the hotel reception.And they claim to be a 4 * hotel! Ridiculous. The cafe/restauant was utterly disgusting. Dirty, disgusting food and VERY I mean, VERY VERY rude staff. I have NEVER seen staff rude like this. The receptionists (except the 2 female) were utterly rude. They had NO manners and were behaving as if the guests are their slaves. I would NEVER ever go and stay in that hotel even if its for free!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Holdaylover12
Reviews.Content: What a stay! I was afraid it would be a bit run down, seeing as this isn't the most luxurious run hotel chain in the world but i was proved wrong! As soon as i walked in i knew i loved it! the building was recently new which added to the ambiance. Although when trying to find the hotel we couldn't find the car park (as the hotel is situated on a one way street) but we parked and went in and the gave us directions on how to get there. The rooms where clean and comfortable! and the food in the restaurant was AMAZING! for a hotel restaurant! we had lunch and breakfast and the breakfast was to die for... they had everything i think i gained a stone just looking at it! but it didn't just look good it tasted amazing! most people are put off by the location but i found it an amazing location! ok yes its a not right beside the Eiffel tower but who cares! its not the only thing to see in France! it was near the 2nd tallest building in France or was it the 1st.... not too sure but you could see for miles! well worth a visit (and its not as expensive or crowded as the Eiffel tower!) Everything in this hotel was amazing apart from the street incident but they can't do anything about that and i am sure if they could they would!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: djvyrus69
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline when I won a name your own price bid. The hotel is in an excellent neighborhood, very quiet and easy access to the whole city. The beds are small, but this is Europe so thats normal. Also I don't know if it was just our room but the shower, sink and toilet all share a floor and nothing to seperate the shower from everything else, so when you took a shower, everything got wet. But no complaints whatsoever, the breakfast buffet on site was excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on a number of occasions and it has always been a pleasurable expericence. located next to the montparnasse train station it give great access to the TGV and is only 300 meteres from the nearest metro station Rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff are very pleasent and efficent

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable but a bit of a walk to public transportation”
Reviews.Author: Nitsun
Reviews.Content: for a paris hotel it was a comfortable size. bathroom was very small - not much larger than one person could fit into. very clean with comfortable beds and air conditioning. closing the windows allowed relative quiet - we were on the 5th floor. restaurant downstairs was not spectaculor but a decent spread of food for breakfast ...which was not included in our room price, though our 15 year old ate free. breakfast included coffees, teas, yogurts, various delicious pastries with butter and jam, scrambled eggs, sausages, potatoes, cereals, oj, fruits, etc., etc. a very nice way to start the day. found lovely restaurants near by - really enjoyed a pizza/pasta one around the corner. all in all - for paris - it was a decent package for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: xq22
Reviews.Content: stayed here in july 2011 with my wife and two daughters. had to come into paris a day earlier since my flights were rescheduled. unfortunately this hotel was fully booked, hence had to stay elsewhere (ibis opera in the bastille region) for a day before moving in here. WHAT a contrast!!! while the ibis was a typical clean matchbox sized functional room, this novotel was so much better the rooms were well sized, front desk was efficient and helpful and guess what...all of them had a smile on their face! this hotel is excellent for families since there were loads of other families with kids in the reception area. somehow, that gives a very comfortable feeling to know that your kids arent going to be unwelcome in the environment. breakfast was nice as well as were the friendly staff access to the hotel is fairly simple, 5 minutes walk from Pasteur metro or the gare montparnasse. the area was safe. we were walking back past midnight 3 nights in a row without any untoward incidents or occurences all in all, this is an excellent hotel and would thoroughly recommend it\\

Reviews.Title: “satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from website of accorhotels and found this hotel was most sutiable for my family of 5 person in term of type of room required (for tripple and connecting room). Locationwise was a bit far compared to Mercure Montpanasse when my family stayed in last Dec but price was cheaper with same quality.

Reviews.Title: “review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Food quality in cafe was below average, but there is a Hippo close by that has better value, better prepared meals. Pasta prepared for us was congealed and almost inedible. This was ignored by the waitress.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Marcusta
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, modern with a fantastic breakfast! Location 2 blocks from metro and only 5 metro stops to Eiffel Tower. Cannot fault this hotel. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel & great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lucas_and_Nikki
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here before and been more than satisfied, we decided to return to the Novotel Montparnasse for our recent trip to Paris. The hotel was exactly as it was the last time - very nice with friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are nice and the other facilities very good too - (free wifi in the rooms is always a good bonus!). The location suited us but the surrounding area is not particularly lively. There's a great pizza restaurant nearby (Pietro) and a few smaller supermarkets around as well. Transport links are great - it's about 5-10 minutes from Gare Montparnasse, and there are a couple of other Metro stations close too. Overall a really nice hotel that ticks all the boxes - definitely one to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good accommodation and location”
Reviews.Author: SkyviewEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in May 2011. Room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. Easy 5 - 8 minute walk to metro (depending on which one). Within 15 minute walking distance to Montparnasse Tower. Hotel staff very helpful and service oriented. We did not eat dinner in the restaurant but did have lunch which was good and reasonably priced. Good restaurants in the area. We would stay at this hotel again the next time we visit Paris - staff were extremely service oriented. Good value. Easy underground car parking and 18 euro's per day for Paris is reasonable. All in all a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: scoa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days at the end of May and paid £123 a night without breakfast. I was a bit concerned as to how far out from the centre we were, but needn't have worried, it was fine and was included on ALL Paris central maps . The hotel is within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and just round the corner from the tube, where there is an Air France bus stop too that shuttles to and from the airport. Across from the bus stop is a small super market that sells everything you may need including sandwiches and snacks. The hotel itself was quite modern and very clean and the TV had a couple of English news channels. When we arrived however, there was just one paper cup with the tea making facilities, which was a bit of a let down, I mean it is supposed to be 4 star, surely cups and saucers aren't asking too much of them? Anyway, at least another one arrived the next day. The bar has the same crazy prices as the rest of Paris, but the wine and the staff were very nice. If you take a map with you and you like walking, it is actually very easy to walk to most places, starting with the Eiffel Tower. The offer I got for the room also included free WIFI, which was an added bonus. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean but small room”
Reviews.Author: PerthSheep
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Novotel hotel and there are no surprises. We were there for a holiday in Paris and it was very good as a base. The room was clean, modern design but small- this is probably the size that you will get in Paris. The Gare Monparnasse (train station) is less than 10 minutes walk and is away from the tourisy area. There are quite a few cafes and restaurants that you can go for breakfast so don't pay 16 Euros per person in the hotel. Good place to stay and will happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Zaventem Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a classical Novotel, so you know more or less what you get. Wifi is free and works well, so for normal use you do not need to pay for the wired internet service. Location is Ok but by no means charming, Metro Pasteur is at 10 minutes walk. The breakfast is charged 16 Euros and is not worth it, as neither the canteen type atmosphere nor the quality of the food justify the price. I signalled the problems I encountered (dirty tables, strangely tasting "scrambled eggs", buffet inondated with milk ...) to the hotel management, who promised to me that my feedback is important to them to improve their services ... To sum it up: OK to sleep there - and have breakfast elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Smart modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACshols
Reviews.Content: Quite new so rooms are very smart and clean. Contemporary styling with comfortable rooms. Very nice to have a kettle in the room too. Great business hotel if you need to be in that area. Plenty of shop and restaurants near by, and very close to metro.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a sensibly priced part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: da1Bristol
Reviews.Content: Conducted alot of research into where to stay in Paris, as told it's expensive. This district came up well for well priced restaurants. It's the business district plenty of restaurants and bakery's around. All the locals and workers use them; you won't find them paying silly prices in the tourist areas. As for the hotel, brilliant, okay the scenery is mostly concrete buildings, but we came to Paris to see the sights. It's clean, staff are very efficient breakfast is good value, have as much as you want. The rooms have excellent sound proofing from outside and they have a fridge in, water topped up daily, very handy. If I had a complaint it would be room service trays with used cups, plates, etc were left in corridor of our floor for four days that we were there. It was obviously not the room maid’s job, as they never touched them. Don't pay the silly prices in the hotel for evening meals I recommend the excellent French restaurant just across the road, a three course meal for 14.50 euro's, it's fresh, well cooked, popular with locals you cannot go wrong at these prices. This hotel is a bit tricky to find, even asking locals a lot of them had never heard of it. This is a district where English is not as well spoken as other parts of Paris, fine by us as my wife and daughter speak good French. Catch metro line 4 to Montparnasse Blevenue and you can actually get to the hotel by heading in the direction of Gare Montparnasse station all underground, follow the outline to the end and you have arrived, side door of Novotel. As for Paris itself it’s not the Paris we remember, of years ago, Police everywhere at tourist spots, sellers swamp you trying to sell you stuff, and plenty of Graffiti at the well known tourist spot’s come on Paris clean things up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms should be a little bigger, there was a very good location but, at night I could hear many noises coming from outside. I also think there should be more food options. I think you could improve these things to make the hotel better. Overall, it is still a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “everything was excellent”
Reviews.Author: oliar
Reviews.Content: "We haven't got complaints from the hotel. It is very close to the monparnasse station. Our room was as we had seen from the pictures of the hotel (clean, quite, comfortable, without view). Breakfast was also very good (we had done reservation with breakfast). Everything was excellent. We suggest it!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite decent hotel but breakfast was a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: artemisworks
Reviews.Content: It is everything you'd expect from a Novotel - stay elsewhere if you're looking for an old, charming hotel full of character, but for a standard business hotel of decent quality, this one will suit the bill very well. We chose this hotel for its close proximity to Gare Montparnasse as we needed to catch an early morning train. It is not that far from the metro station (Montparnasse Bienvenue) if you follow the signs from inside the metro station and walk through Gare Montparnasse - you can reach the hotel without even having to venture outdoors in bad weather! The room itself was a very respectable size by Paris standards, and the TV had cable channels as well. Everything was modern, clean and tidy, and it was also very quiet at night. There was also free wi-fi available in the rooms. The only niggle we had was that the reception staff failed to inform us that breakfast was NOT included in the price, and it was a rather exorbitant 16 EUR per person -- which would not have been that bad if the breakfast was not bad, but the croissants and pastries were really below par! So breakfast was a rip-off and slightly spoiled our stay but we would not hesitate to stay here again if needed, since it is conveniently close to Gare Montparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but had to endure bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: Pritz26
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located with a 5 minute walk from a large Metro station allowing easy access to all the major attractions. The rooms are a decent size and appear clean, but my friend and I woke after our first nights sleep with over 20 bed-bug bites! When we informed the staff member at reception, she condescendingly reassured us that sheets are changed daily with no apology. While we were eventually given another room for the remaining 2 nights and offered meagre compensation of a single breakfast charge, the damage had already been done. One week on, our bites have not healed and they are very likely to leave scars! It is appalling that this can happen in a 4 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quite and Comfortable, Good to have as a base.”
Reviews.Author: JacBanf
Reviews.Content: Traveled with 1 teenager and 3 friends. Contacted hotel prior to arrival for directions to hotel, prompt reply with very good (and necessary) instructions. We had booked 4 rooms, 2 were ready when we arrived slight problem getting keys for other 2 later in the day due to communication problems but soon sorted. This was the only time we had any issues with reception. All rooms clean and air conditioning available. Very quite where we were, 7th floor. Our rooms overlooked train station which you can hear if window open but no noise at all when shut. Very comfortable beds. We had a family room with double sofa bed, also comfortable. Small fridge in room with one small bottle of water daily. Tea and coffee though did not use them. Free Wi Fi in rooms, each room gets a code, great for all the I phone users!!! We had breakfast included in price. Very good selection, buffet style, English, cooked and continental. Good to fill up on before busy day out exploring. Plenty of restaurants around area either towards Montparnasse Tower or towards Metro, Pastuer is the nearest. We ate in the hotel on our last evening as we were tired and it was raining. We did pay a lot more to eat here, more than we had any other night, but the food was good and obviously convenient. Hotel location was good for us. Arrived Montparnasse Bievennue metro about a 15 minute walk through train station to hotel. Travellator when arriving but not when returning.LOTS of stairs so if these are difficult for you maybe use a different Metro station. There are little ramps to pull cases up and down on next to stairs. Loved that you could see the Eiffel Tower just at the end of the road. As for getting into the center of Paris we used the Pasteur Metro which was a 5 - 10 min walk. Always had frequent trains. Having never stayed in Paris I have nothing to compare this too but would definitely stay here again, the only reason I would choose somewhere else was if I found a real bargain!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Confort hotel well situated”
Reviews.Author: BG-ZH Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel directly at Montparnasse station Rooms are quiet, clean, and big enough for a nice weekend. The lobby is nicely decorated, staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoLaIreland
Reviews.Content: Great hotel , modern and really clean. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is very far from metro”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: there was problem with the hit in the room for 4 days without good soultion

Reviews.Title: “It's a good hotel. I think you can find a cheaper one. Too expensive for the quality. With parking.”
Reviews.Author: paris_genoa
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the hotel comfort, but I repeat my opinion: it cost too much. However it's right in the center of the city. very close to the metro and train station (pasteur or montparnasse), clean and with private parking.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: DeaSR
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my mum and my sister to Paris mid October. It was hard to find a well located, good value for money hotel with accomodation comfortable enough for 3 people and Novotel Gare Montparnasse suited well to the purpose. The room was clean, breakfast was good, staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was very close to Gare Montparnasse and just 5 minutes walk to Pasteur metro station with nice restaurants, bakery and shops also at walking distance. We were very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliantly convenient for taking off to the south”
Reviews.Author: Bevcarriage
Reviews.Content: Warm and very comfortable. Maybe a little soulless but to be honest for a one night overnight before heading off early to the Spanish border this just wasn´t a problem. The hotel is no more than a five minute walk to Montparnasse station. We decided to eat in the hotel restaurant too. Not haute cuisine but again perfectly good food with a decent choice between steak, chicken with the proverbial chips and some pasta too. Very friendly and efficient service. A reasonable price for a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Great budget stay in the heart of Paris for all the family.”
Reviews.Author: JonahMH
Reviews.Content: Friendly modern hotel very close to the centre of Paris.....we managed to walk with our 8 and 6 year old children to the Eiffel tower. Spotlessly clean, really helpful staff and a great room made our two night stay amazing value for money and very comfortable especially given the high cost of everything else in Paris. The staff were so so helpful and really could not do enough for us. Would def return for what was the start of an amazing trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- more than expected”
Reviews.Author: jenicol
Reviews.Content: Great service and excellent room Free wi fi appreciated! Ate in the restaurant and it was pretty good No negative to speak of- overall great for a business stop over

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Accommodation at Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: gellg
Reviews.Content: We found the service provided by the Novotel Paris Montparnasse excellent. The staff very efficient and helpful and not only did they offer us an upgrade on our reserved accommodation but whilst we were waiting for the upgrade to become available (albeit a only a few minutes) we were offered a welcome drink. The breakfast was superb with a great range to choose from. Although we had the advantage of upgraded facilities which was extremely clean, comfortable and spacious, we had the opportunity to view a standard room which also had all of those qualities. The hotel is in a quiet location and close to many facilities/attractions - just around the corner from Gare Montparnasse, Tour Montparnasse, Galeries Lafayette and Jardin Du Luxembourg and with a just a few steps away for a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money but watch out for breakfast prices!”
Reviews.Author: sus63uk
Reviews.Content: My husband, 7-year-old daughter and I stayed in a Superior room = "double" bed (but I would classify it as larger, more like a queen size) + sofa bed which (a double size), on the 5th floor. Hotel prices in Paris are ridiculous, so when I found this online by hunting out the best price and got it for £125.00 GBP I was very pleased with myself. I took tips from prior reviewers and we found the hotel behind the Gare Montparnasse station easily enough; you can actually walk through a shortcut to get into the front of the train station from the hotel once you get your bearings, and then there's another few minutes walk to the Metro part of the station. So really the hotel is situated pretty close to public transport (we took Metro from Gare du Nord into Gare Montparnasse = 15 minutes tops, then walked around the side of the Montparnasse station for maybe another 5-10 minutes to get to hotel). Our room was spotlessly clean, really and truly, which is very important for us. It seemed recently refurbished and we didn't see any of the usual wear and tear you find in hotels. Both beds had fabulous mattresses (even the sofa bed), and spotlessly clean and comfortable/cotton sheets. Bathroom fixtures were of high quality, walk-in shower was superb, and sink very modern and swish. Again, bathroom was spotless. The room was a good size and had flat screen TV, mini-fridge (with complementary bottle of water: nice touch!), and coffee/tea-making tray. A prior reviewer complained about the view, and yes, when we pushed the curtains to the side we were facing a car park, but we weren't there to look at that, were we! We checked in on Saturday lunchtime, went out to sightsee and didn't return until 9pm that night, then had a brilliant sleep (after using very quick and courteous room service at 11pm for 2 glasses of wine). Our only complaint would be the price of the breakfast, which is "free" for kiddies but 15 euros for adults. It was a gorgeous breakfast, with almost everything you could wish for (eggs, bacon, sausages, crepes, breads & pastries, cereals, fruits, etc) and was truly delicious, but at the end of the day you could quite happily walk out to a nearby cafe for much less money and have just as nice a breakfast. So overall I'd highly recommend this hotel if you want a very clean budget-friendly and well-located hotel in Paris, with easy access to the Metro and all the sights. Would definitely book here again, and any other Novotels for that matter, if they're all supposed to be like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and like home!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Staff was amazing and very accommodating! A walk from a metro station but who cares about walking when you are in Paris! Soak up the sights and smells!! This hotel will make you feel at home and comfortable. Small fridge was awesome to bring back some refreshments! LOVE this hotel. Will stay again..soon.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Sidneyleee
Reviews.Content: I decided to go with the Novotel Montparnasse hotel after reading the reviews of the other travellers on the site. To be honest, I couldn't be happier!! This hotel is excellent in so many ways: 1. Location: Located in a very convenient area where it's easily accessed by metro and bus. The walk from the metro station (Pasteur) to the hotel is around 6 minutes. If one chooses to take the air france bus #4 from CDG to the hotel, the walk is just around 7 minutes. I would recommend that if you have a lot of luggage. The hotel is also situated closely to bus stations that simply take you to most areas of Paris (such as sacred ceour, St. Germaine des Pres, Louvre, Seine river, Bastile, L'opera etc) For those who loves to bike, the velib station is just located outside the hotel, you can bike to many places from there! 2. Room: Our room is situated on the 6/F, though it's close to the elevator, it was quiet, spacious, and clean. Bathroom and toilet are separated, but it works out perfectly. Everything is great in the room! 3. Service: Staff are really nice and friendly. Also very helpful in many ways. The only down side about the service is the housekeeping staff keep entering the room despite the Do No Disturb sign was up. They did it for a few times. 4. Food: I didn't eat at the hotel at all, but there are quite some choices around the area, one of them is called La Salle a manager (something like that), that's right next to the metro station. 17.9 Euro for a fixed price 2 course meal. The food was very decent. Great service too! Also, the famous Pierre Herme is just next to the metro as well! I am not going to post any pictures because they are exactly the same as the ones on their website! Check it out!! I couldn't be happier with my stay at the Novotel Montparnasse. Definitely a recommendation for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Novotel - Solid”
Reviews.Author: World17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and 2 boys (9 & 12 years-old) in mid-August. Finding the hotel is half the challenge. We arrived by train and Gare Montparnasse is a mammoth nightmare of a train station. The hotel is tucked behind the station on a back street and by the time we had gotten it figured out it was 3 days later and time to leave. As for the hotel itself, it was clean, with free internet in the lobby, free newspapers in the morning and free breakfast, which was a touch crowded, but generally good. The staff was friendly and seemed to try hard, but was not incredibly helpful, although they obligingly lent us a voltage converter when ours failed. The air conditioning is in name only, but the room was sizable enough and had a small fridge and a free daily bottle of Evian. Once you figure out the train station (hint, go out the side door of the hotel, not the front), it is a quick Metro ride to the major tourist sites, although the Eiffel Tower is by no means an impossible walk. The Montparnasse area itself is not the most thrilling, but it is certainly safe and with breakfast included in our rate, the Novotel is a really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families with young kids”
Reviews.Author: KarenVABeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night over the weekend. It was easy to find with the GPS. We came on a Sunday afternoon, and traffic to it wasn't that bad. The parking is 18 Euros and very secure. The hotel is quite a distance from the attractions. There is a metro station across the street. The room was very comfortable. We had a double bed and a sofa that pulled out into two twin beds. The bathroom had both a tub and a separate shower. The toilet was in a separate room, by the door. We had plenty of room for our two kids, luggage, and a jogging stroller. The reception personnel were very polite. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to anyone traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean accomodation - be prepared to use the Metro”
Reviews.Author: TGordL
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Paris for a week and we stayed at the Novotel Montparnasse. For a hotel in Paris, it's clean, reasonably sized and modern (opened in 2006). Our accomodations on the 5th floor consisted of reasonably sized room with a double bed and a sofa bed, a room for the toilet, a room with a sink, shower and bath tub. Note the shower was a typical shower stall (e.g. North American style) versus a tub with a shower head and a partial shower curtain more consistent with some of the older hotels in Paris. Our room had a mini fridge, a safe and a reasonably sized flat screen tv. We were able to manage the temperature of the room to our level of comfort through the heating/air conditioning system. We also had a window that we could open a few inches to allow fresh air in. Overall the room worked well for the two of us. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and housekeeping did a good job each day keeping our room clean. There's a computer in the lobby with free internet access that you can use for twenty minutes at a time (regulated by software that countsdown and then logs you off if you don't do it yourself). The hotel offers free wifi but I only managed to get it to work and connect with a strong enough signal in the lobby. There's a restaurant in the lobby, we had dinner there one night and my daughter and I both found our meals to be pretty bland. There are lots of other options within walking distance (4 to 5 blocks) in different directions. As some other guests have mentioned there is scent in the lobby area. We noticed misters against the wall that would shoot out streams of fragranced mist. It wasn't an issue for us but I can see that it could be a problem for some people who are sensitive to these sorts of things. The hotel is a little ouf of the way but if you are willing to walk a couple of blocks to get to the Metro then Paris is at your beck and call. We did a lot of metro riding (get one of the multi day passes for good value) and saw many areas of Paris. In terms of getting to or from the hotel we rode the Metro (subway) from Charles de Gaulle airport having to make 1 transfer along the way to get to the hotel. The nearest Metro stations (Pasteur, Montparnasse Bienvenue) are about 3 to 4 blocks away. For those who want a more direct route to/from the hotel to the airport, Air France runs a bus service (16.5 euros one way, cheaper for a return ticket) that drops off/picks up about 3 blocks from the hotel. As it was August, several restaurants, boulangeries, etc. in the neighbourhood were closed due to vacations. We were happy with our stay there as it was very reasonable in terms of price and on top of that there's a great view of the Eiffel tower from the end of the street!

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: ope557
Reviews.Content: When traveling in Europe we often stay at Novotel hotels because they are very accommodating to families with children. It can be especially hard to find a reasonably priced hotel in Paris that will let all four of us stay in one room. This Novotel did allow us all in one room and the hotel is quite good with kids, they have a book corner with kids' books, coloring books, etc. Overall I would describe the hotel as functional, there is no particular charm but it is modern, clean, friendly and in a good location. The rooms are average size for Paris which is to say pretty small but that's what you get in Paris. Overall I recommend it the price and location and family policy are a good match.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money. Great if you're travelling with kids.”
Reviews.Author: TabbyMcTat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and also because we needed to catch a train from Gare Montparnasse early the next day. It was a bit of a pain to get to mainly because I hadn't realised that Montparnasse Bienvenue metro station wasn't the closest metro so we ended up walking a fair distance with luggage and pushchair. Montparnasse itself isn't a great location but it's well connected and you can walk to nicer areas like Jardins de Luxembourg quite easily. The hotel itself was great. We took advantage of a special deal on the Novotel website (which claims to always offer the lowest price which is worth bearing in mind before you book through Expedia or Lastminute or any other holiday site) so it only cost us £80. The room had a big double bed as well as a sofa bed for our daughter. It was spotless, really quiet and had a decent sized bathroom. I thought it was a really good size for a Parisian hotel room. I would stay here again if I was travelling from Montparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “The best Novotel in France I've been to.”
Reviews.Author: bsillon
Reviews.Content: Simple as that. Ok, beware this is still a "chain" Business Hotel, not really charming, but the lobby was always crowed and lively, and the quality of the accommodation makes it a good choice. I had a good check in experience and good advices by Jacques; a nice, large clean room (superior) on the top floor (6th). Note that some rooms on this floor have a view on the "tour Eiffel", sadly it wasn't our case this time, but if that's something you want I'm pretty sure rooms 611 to 615 have that view (to be confirmed). In anycase, ask for it! We choose the hotel because of it's closeness with Gare Montparnasse which was great for us since we had taken the High Speed Train (TGV) from the countryside. The Montparnasse area itself has nothing really exciting, but it's not the worse area of Paris either. Subway is 5 minutes away (Pasteur or Montparnasse Bienvenue, the first one being an outdoor line, nice...). We did not eat in the hotel (that look pricy too be honest), since there are so many nicer places to eat in Paris for breakfast (try a french classic: cafe+croissant at a nearby brasserie on blvd Pasteur). All in all, this is the best Novotel I've been to in France so far.

Reviews.Title: “Good - will probably go again”
Reviews.Author: rrrmail
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel, however, finding it was not easy. If you are a first-timer with no French skills (this is not a dig at the hotel, but, Parisians seem to take pride in not speaking english or resisting it to the extent of being rude), you better know how to get there. A big suggestion is to have them put in a detailed map of their location with respect to the train station and possible directions if coming from CDG or any other place. We had an issue with bathroom shower stall leaking water, but, when reported they sent the person right away and we were not ready for him. Another point is that the hotel staff just barge in instead of knocking and waiting for response - am not sure if it is cultural. The room, though small, did accomodate two adults and two young children (under 12). I am not sure it is the practice but the toilet and bathroom are separate - meaning you need to literally walk around to the bathroom as there is no wash basin in the toilet. Depending on whether you are a clean/washing type person, this can be a pain! Not sure why they have it that way! The general location is in a quieter neighborhood. Can walk to metro/train stations if you are the walking type. From here, you can get to most places through metro/train. Not too many food choices, but, enough to eat out for a few days. We were only there for two-nights, so it was quite adequate. Overall, the front desk folks were quite helpful. Will not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but free internet connection”
Reviews.Author: Paoletor
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not particularly luxury or spacious, by functional and clean. The location is not in a picturesque zone, but very near to Montparnasse train station and restaurants. The service is good and so is the breakfast. I really appreciated the free internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Kat-9975
Reviews.Content: Novotel Montparnasse is easy to reach from Orly using Air France buses. The buses end their destination at Place de Catalogne and then it's a 2 minute walk to the hotel. The hotel's building is new and this is the most important in Paris, since old buildings are turned into hotels and you can encounter many problems (noise, water, smell). The hotel has many offers throughout the year and we used an offer of a stay including breakfast which was very very nice. Pasteur metro station is near and the neighborhood is really nice with restaurants and bistros. The room was very clean and the mini bar not expensive. Stuff was helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, cool & clean.”
Reviews.Author: Willyboy74
Reviews.Content: Modern small room. The queen foam bed was unbelievably comfortable. Good A/C. It worked well for us to come back to a cool, comfortable, quiet room to rest after long hard days of sightseeing. Close to transportation, cafes, etc. New and clean. Good restaurant. Room service quick .Staff was able to handle English speaking guests. Would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern hotel in business area”
Reviews.Author: Usenko
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in December, 2 days before New Year. We arrived by a public transport, and it was a bit difficult to find the hotel if you heading there from a metro. However the second time it was easy since we remember the path. Novotel occupies the modern new building. Lobby looks very stylish and contemporary. There are a lot of families in the hotel. I think that is because children under 16 have bed and breakfast for free according Novotel policy. The room was the same as all other Novotels have. It is clean and functional, but not charming. To be honest I have nothing to complain about. From our window I managed to see Eiffel Tower. Montparnasse Tower is in 2 blocks away from Novotel. The surrounding area has business buildings mainly. But if you walk several blocks you will find charming small shops and restaurants with nice girls sitting outside with a glass of champagne. Anyhow I liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “liked this hotel very much but you must understand location”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: this hotel has many features that i likes as: connected rooms for traveling with kids free breakfast for under 16 spotless rooms its a new hotel or at least looks like friendly staff expensive but ultra dependable shuttle service to airports i personally loved decoration loved inner rooms with no street noise at all modern and well insulated rooms sofa bed in both connected rooms safe area plenty of inexpensibe restaurants in montparnasse area loved indian in front of pizza pino not expensive i payed 2000 euros for 8 nights in 2 rooms bad things are: small rooms but average to paris in my opinion anyway sleeps 5 in two connected rooms for 6 will be crowded there is not an experience here just lodging location has to be understood you will be far from everything but we walk every night around one hour to get back and love it pasteur station is the one you want to use montparnasse its crowded finally when going out and heading to montparnasse area your first instint will be making a right and start walking: that will put you through car parks, train stations and endless stairs walk a few meters left and take second right and you will have a beautifull stroll trough Vaugirard Bld and you will end in the same place but with a much nicer walk

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, especially with children”
Reviews.Author: thedutchmen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 4 children (15, 14, 12 and 9) for a midweek city trip. We were out all day and evenings, so we used the hotel to sleep and have breakfast. The rooms are clean and the beds are good. Inside the room you don't hear anything. It,s a 1 mn. walk to the nearest busstation en 5 mnts. to the metro and to the "Tour Montparnasse". The staff was friendly. Children under 16 who share a room with a parent can stay for free in the hotel, breakfast is also free for them. You can park you car in the garage for EUR 15,00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, but look elsewhere for character and culture...”
Reviews.Author: Flamenco_Sun
Reviews.Content: This is very much a business hotel (the kind of place where middle-aged businessmen loosen their ties and sit in the bar area during the evening...), but it performs this role very well. I too was there for business, which is the only reason I'd stay somewhere so modern and sterile. It may be lacking in character and soul (to the point that you won't even be aware you're in Paris!), but this is a big, efficient and comfortable hotel to stay in. The rooms are well appointed, spotlessly clean, and there's free wi-fi if you want it. Work commitments also meant that I ate in the restaurant there for 2 nights in a row. It's not a nice dining environment (the lights are VERY bright in there), but the food was OK. It's not somewhere I'd want to eat if it wasn't being paid for on expenses, but the steaks are pretty tasty, and there's a good wine list. I'd also point out that there's not a lot of restaurants within easy walk of this hotel, so you should do some homework of where to eat before you get there. The breakfasts are expensive (a 15 euro buffet with a limited choice of food) and not great quality, so I'd recommend that you find yourself somewhere else for coffee and croissants in the morning. The hotel is more or less part of the massive Montparnasse railway station, and surrounded by modern, characterless sprawl. So don't come here to be in the heart of culture or to see the more romantic side of Paris. And you're quite a long way from the best parts of Paris out here. A couple of minor niggles: the staff are a little arrogant and not particuarly helpful. I asked if they could book a taxi for an hour's time, and they refused. They told me to come back ten minutes before I needed one. That may be ok to them, but if you HAVE to be at a meeting at a particular time, it's a little scary to cut it that fine. Also, the lifts need your room key to activate them. This really got on my nerves in the end. All in all though, it's a comfortable if functional place to stay. It's not the sort of place you would ever wax lyrical about, but I don't think that's the market Novotel are after.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: minky35
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel in a superb location only a few minutes walk up hill from Pasteur Metro and right next to SNCF Gare Montparnasse. I requested a high floor with Eiffel view during online booking and this is exactly what we were given on check in. Perfect. Great staff, plush lobby, reception area and hotel bar and extremely well serviced facilities. The rooms are spacious with ample storage, good lighting options and a fresh bathroom with large walk in power shower. The only thing I could pick on was the pod style plastic sink, but this is a common feature in Accor hotels and is cheap to install. Tea and coffee facilities, fridge, air con, flat screen TV and hair dryer as standard. A bonus was that the fridge was not stocked with expensive mini bar drinks so we used this to store cheap beers and juices from the local supermarket. The interesting area of Montparnasse is on the doorstep where there are a fantastic range of bars, cafes and restaurants. I would certainly stay here again if the internet rates were favourable.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, guests from everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: floridatraveldad
Reviews.Content: The poor staff at this place. We were checking in at the same time as a family from Spain and another group from Italy. No one could quite figure out what language to speak. It all worked out well, though. The fellow checking us in spoke poor English, but we both were passable at Spanish, so that's what WE were speaking. Many other staff were fluent in English, by the way. Rooms were small--what else is new in Paris. They were comfy, though, and extremely clean. The dining area has not been commented on much on trip advisor. Our first night there we were tired and ate dinner at the hotel restaurant. Very nice food, good service--for first night, or after a long day of touring, the restaurant is fine. Maybe average for Paris, 99th percentile for London. The morning meal was buffet--most guests had the breakfast included in their room charge, and it was quite good. Service for both meals was excellent. Location was fine. We could walk to Blvd. Montparnasse, which had many restaurants, creperies, stores, etc. Eiffel Tower was about 2 miles away--walkable, but a quick cab ride could get you there for a few euros. Closest underground station was less than a 10 minute walk. Now, I don't speak a word of French. I loved Paris. If you try to communicate, and are nice, they will respond in kind (most of the time). Parisians obviously think they live in the best city in the world (they may be right), and that opinion is reflected in their personalities, but who among us does not think that we live in the greatest city/town/country in the world?

Reviews.Title: “A kick needed up their complacency!”
Reviews.Author: LondonShaun
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at around 10:30am, and were pleased that the room was ready. It was clean and functional, no complaints about the bathroom etc (though I’m not sure I like the fact that the toilet is in a separate room with no sink – which has unfortunate hygiene implications). We spent a few hours in the room, resting from our journey. Later we decided to have some coffee and water etc. Despite being told at check-in that as standard there would be a bottle of mineral water plus tea and coffee making facilities in the room, we found there was no water, only one sachet of decaff coffee and no spoons. We of course called reception and were given the missing items. This, we thought, would be the end of the matter, but were we ever wrong! The next morning, the room was serviced while we were off touring Paris. When we got back, there was no water, no coffee, no milk, no cups. We had to call reception again for the items to be replaced (is it too much to have a cup of tea in your room?) On day 3, the hotel outdid themselves. On the previous day, we had bought a few snacks to make sandwiches for our dinner, as we didn’t fancy the hotel menu, as well as a bottle of milk to make tea (well, we’re British; we like our tea!).
