On our return from our 3rd day of touring, we found there was no water again, but this time our snacks and milk had also been taken!! Why, is what I asked reception!! After 3 phone calls to reception, they finally brought us some food to compensate. It turned out to be a tray of things we didn’t like to eat, so pointless (they could have at least asked what we like!). To top it all, the internet access code we’d been given at check-in was suddenly invalid – very annoying. One other thing, we slept in late on day two and were surprised to find that the cleaning staff would knock on the door and immediately use there card to enter the room! I've stayed in dozens of hotels - for business and leisure - and have never encountered this before. Normally, staff would knock and give time for me to come to the door. What an outrageous invasion of privacy. Now I’m not saying this hotel was a complete shambles, but they almost seemed to go out of their way to annoy us, by getting wrong many of the little things you would expect to be de-rigueur in a hotel, even a standard hotel Having my property taken from me by the cleaner REALLY cheesed me off!

Reviews.Title: “Always welcome in this hotel and excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ben_steph
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I are used to staying in this hotel, we have been there three times in the 2009 and we have always been pleased by the front desk staff and the quality of the rooms. The rooms are modern, clean and biggish. The hotel is very well located in the Montparnasse area with all its bars and restaurants. It is also really easy to reach the Eiffel Tower or the Champs Elysees. The early bird rates are really good and include breakfasts most of the time. Buying breakfast on top of the room may not be worth it as it is really easy to find a decent cafe or bakery in Paris. PS: I really like the sent in the hotel lobby ;) I would definitely recommend this hotel and we will go back there surely in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay very clean , liked the free wifi, within a few metro stops to major attractions”
Reviews.Author: flybynite2
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights the hotel is in a residential neighborhood, lots of restaurants near by metro within a 10 min walk, also a major train station the Garre Montparnasse for trains to go outside of Paris. the staff were very helpfull with suggestions. i would definetely go back also had in room mini refrigerator and a kettle to brew hot water for tea and coffee which was complimentary. I enjoy a cup of tea in the AM and liked i did not have to leave my room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and a nice experience overall”
Reviews.Author: EuroJapanFamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a rather modern, uninspiring area of Paris. It might be very convenient for those who have to catch an early morning train at the Montparnasse station, as it is located almost above the platforms. The Air France shuttle bus terminal to Orly and Charles de Gaulle airports are also less thant 10 minutes away by foot. But the nearest metro stations (Montparnasse-Bienvenue and Gaite) are quite a long walk away. I heard that the premium rooms have good views over the Eiffel Tower and the city, but my standard room just looked over a rather depressing parking lot. So this might not be the better option if what you need is a base to explore Paris, or a romantic getaway for your honeymoon. That said, almost everything is very satisfying at the Novotel Montparnasse. Rooms are immaculately clean, soundproof, with comfortable beds and very functionnal (but it would have been a good idea to put a power plug in the bathroom). Above all, everyone here is professionnal, friendly and helpful, which is really outstanding in a city where disastrous levels of service are unfortunately still too common. The restaurant serves good traditionnal french food in a nice modern atmosphere. The breakfast buffet is also fairly good, although the standard coffee pot put on every table is absolutely awful (I asked for an expresso instead, and it was brought to me swiftly and without extra charge). Overall a pleasant experience at this hotel. The only really bad point, which is common to every Novotel, is the charge for broadband internet connexion: 20 euros per day! This is unbelievable. I am now staying at a very modest hotel in northern France and it has free wifi connexion, which happens to be much faster than the one in the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique...”
Reviews.Author: tell-it-as-it-is47
Reviews.Content: This really was a brilliant hotel. Great rooms with both a shower and a bath. It was also nice to have a separate toilet (as there were 4 sharing the room). It was clean, the staff were really helpful. The only negative was that as we had two rooms (due to the number of children) they did not have, would not allocate rooms with interconnecting doors. Nor had they booked the rooms next door to each other. Anyway, I will stay here again next time I am in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Very good modern style hotel”
Reviews.Author: MNCtravelling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on a sightseeing trip to Paris. We found the staff at check in to be very helpful and friendly (despite our near non- existent French) including pointing out a short cut to the metro station from the rear of the hotel. The room was of a very good size for a European hotel and quite modern. The bed was large and comfortable. The bathroom was also a good size and very clean. We were able to sleep with the window open as our room at the front of the hotel was on a quiet street. We found the location to be good. Around the hotel itself there is not much to see or do but it is only a 7 minute walk to the metro (using shortcut). We felt safe returning to the hotel late at night. If you are looking for a hotel with old world Parisian charm/decor and the major sights and sounds of Paris on your doorstep, then this is not the right hotel for you. However, if you are a looking for a clean and comfortable modern hotel with good service and amenities at a reasonable price (by Parisian standards) and handy location to the metro then this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: PremchandT
Reviews.Content: Impeccable with a view to the memorable n lovable Eiffel tower.....matched with a gr8 hospitality. Must go for nebody traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but not the perfect Parisian getaway”
Reviews.Author: Kanade
Reviews.Content: Paris is a very expensive city to stay in, and my father and I eventually decided upon the Novotel Montparnasse when we found a good rate on the Accor website for five nights and breakfast included. But this hotel is good, and not great at anything. Don't expect to find an authentic French experience here either. There are no twin rooms - instead, I had to sleep on a sofa bed, which was not altogether uncomfortable. The bathroom did have a separate shower and bathtub, and there was a safe and some hanging space. Breakfast is largely continental but there are some hot options. There's free internet on an iMac in the lobby, and the staff do speak good English. Walking and public transport are not normally a problem for us, but this hotel really is very far from the best part of Paris. Montparnasse is a concrete jungle and it's mainly apartments and offices. You could either leave the hotel from the front door and walk down towards the Tour Montparnasse, which is the centre of the area where the station is, and some shops and restaurants, or you could take the shortcut by leaving from the side exit and walking along the platforms to the metro station. Either way it's still quite a walk, and then you have to get on the metro to go anywhere interesting in Paris. I'm a bit disappointed. Some rooms have views of the Eiffel Tower but ours did not. If you could afford to, then I think you should try to find a hotel in a better location. If you're on a budget and don't want to take a risk, then it's a familiar Novotel - a safe option. Just make the most of your time in Paris, and don't spend all day in the hotel! The room service was fantastic though - cheaper than many restaurants around the place, tasted great, and a genuine option for us hungry travellers at 5.30 or 6pm when the real French restaurants don't get going until after 9!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: SuzyBerkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August and got a good deal booking through Eurostar. We found the Receptionists to be very cheery and helpful on arrival. We were first given a disabled room on the 2nd floor which we weren't too happy with so we went back to Reception and the pleasant receptionist gave us another room on the 5th floor which was so much better and had a view of the Tour Montparnasse. The room was of a good size and was very clean. Toiletries were replaced daily. The fridge and aircon was great in the summer heat. A previous reviewer said that the UK adaptors do not work in the sockets, but ours worked fine. We didn't have the breakfast at 17 Euros as we thought it was a bit expensive so we stocked our fridge with yoghurts, etc. We preferred to use the Pasteur metro, it's a downhill walk from the hotel and we found it quicker than trying to walk through all the tunnels at Montparnasse station. The hotel room was very quiet with no train noise. To operate the lift you need to insert your bedroom key and then press the floor, otherwise the lift won't go anywhere. My only 2 criticisms are: a) the shower screen was very narrow so the bathroom floor got very wet each time we showered. A shower curtain would have been more suitable. b) it would be good if there was a mirror above the desk as the nearest mirror was in the bathroom and on the bathroom door which folded out. The nearest socket to the bathroom was on the other side of the bed so using my hair tongs was a bit tricky whilst trying to look in the mirror. Other than that, we thought it was a good hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, comfortable hotel - but location not great”
Reviews.Author: Themelbournefalcon
Reviews.Content: I can't really fault the hotel itself. The rooms were immaculately clean and decent-sized, with good bathroom, huge bed and plenty of space. Tellie showed a number of channels in English. Kettle and fridge were provided free of charge. The lobby, bar and breakfast areas are classy and service was great. We got a great deal online too and so the price was pretty good. Beautiful decor. The only problem really was the location, as other reviewers have said. It wasn't terrible - it was located almost right next a large Metro station and easy walk to the Eiffel Tower. But the area itself was drab - quite safe but not much going on, unless you walk for at least ten minutes. The cafes and restaurants in the area were crap, although there was a large supermarket nearby. I would recommend this but only if you could get a really good deal (and there was nothing equivalent in a better area).

Reviews.Title: “Nice sized rooms, good location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dougkeene
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate via a discount service and weren't expecting too much, but the hotel was very clean, looked new, big rooms for Paris. We took the Air France bus from CDG. It was the last stop, so easy to know when to get off. From there, it was only two or three blocks, but it was a bit difficult to find. Study your map! Walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. The Gare Montparnasse is only a five minute walk--a good way to get to Cannes. All in all, a very nice stay, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel a Bit Away from the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: rlvtanner
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Europe as a surprise for her birthday. I found this hotel at a discounted price directly from Accor.com (likely due to the "crisis"). While it was a bit further away from the main attractions we would be visiting it proved to be an very good hotel and an exceptional value. The hotel has a modern feel and the lobby certainly tries to be chic. The rooms are generous by Parisian standards and the pull out bed would be great for a small family. The bed was on the firm side of our tastes but not outside the norm of good hotels elsewhere. The walk to the métro is a bit of a hike but my wife and I found a great café to stop at each morning before we began our adventures. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel and for the price it was excellent. At a higher price we might have preferred something a bit closer in to the major attractions but such was not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest People in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkPickytraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night after returning from the countryside and before taking the train to London from the Gare du Nord (not Gare Montparnasse). We chose the hotel because it had a parking garage where we could keep our rental car and sounded reasonably priced. When we checked in, the people behind the desk were so lovely to our two daughters, ages 5 and 7. We had been in France for almost two weeks and were suprised how little interest most of the French had in our children. But this was a completely different experience. They let each child choose a special small stuffed animal. They also offered us an upgrade to a suite for just a little bit more money. The room was completely amazing - totally comfortable and modern with an awesome terrace. The breakfast the next morning (free for kids) was just perfect for families. Needless to say, we hated leaving. Although the location is not in the heart of Paris, it is definitely a good choice for people who want some comfort at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Anneandfamily
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day trip to Paris and had an excellent stay here. The receptionist when we arrived was very friendly and helpful. Our room was great, large clean and very modern, my son loved it (he is 14). We had the breakfast each morning and were very impressed with it and thought it was good value for money - my son had a free breakfast as well each morning (and he ate more than me!). We were well situated for getting around Paris. We walked to the Eiffel Tower (which you can see from the Hotel) and also to the Louve and other places. We also used the Metro which was very easy to use and right by the Hotel (get the Number 4 Line from Gare Du Nord to the Hotel and walk up to the Hotel. The Staff were very friendly all through our staff and we had a great time - I would high recommend it for value and convenience. We booked our stay with our Eurostar Tickets and we got a great deal through their website. Paris can be expensive but overall we had a reasonably priced stay and I would certainly go back to this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent view”
Reviews.Author: JaneSM
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for our wedding anniversary. There were so many hotels to choose from that in the end we decided to go with a well known brand so it might not be the most romantic but at least we'd have air conditioning, staff that spoke English (in case of any major problems that my French wouldn't cover) and a comfy bed. On the request form we asked for a view of the Eiffel Tower as it was our anniversary not thinking we would actually get it as we had paid a cheap price for the hotel as part of a deal so we thought we'd get the worst room but when we turned up we were shocked to find we were on the top floor (8th) with a perfect view of the tower. This was amazing as every night at 1am having come back from a night out we got to watch the light show on the tower. The room was large for a basic room, there was no mini bar but there was a fridge for free use (which we prefer as the mini bar prices are always so expensive). The bathroom was well equipped and very clean. There were a few metro stations within a 5 / 10 minute walk which was fine (pasteur was the one we used the most) and it didn't take long at all to get to any of the major attractions in Paris so we were very pleased because the hotels further in were a lot more expensive. The staff were very friendly and always helpful. There are a few attractions within walking distance as well (catacombs, montparnasse tower, montparnasse cemetary). We did walk to the Eiffel Tower on the first day too (and all round Paris then back again!) which was a long day but can be done if you wanted to stay past the last metro home and didn't want to pay for a taxi. Can't comment on the food but it seemed reasonably priced (i.e. same price as other restaurants we saw). I would certainly stay here again if I returned to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for Exploring Paris.”
Reviews.Author: gin99uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a typical Novotel, clean comfortable and due to a 4 nights for 3 offer, good value. We got the RER from CGD to Denfert-Rochereau and then the Metro to Pasteur and walked the 500m to the hotel from there. We got the 5 day Metro/RER pass from CDG, seemed to be reasonable value. (We used the metro/RER to get around most of the time.) Compared to the north of England beer and food prices were universally expensive in Paris, you just have to grin and bare the 7+ euros per pint. Only disappointment with the hotel was breakfast which was poor and expensive. Try one of the cafes near Montparnasse station or Pasteur station for breakfast. This was our first time in Paris and I would recommend the Tour Montparnasse as a must for a great view of Paris. About 10 euros to go to the top floor and get access to the roof. Less queues (actually none when we went at 10am on a Monday) than the Eiffel Tower with equally good view. Visit the Louvre, which is great even if like, me, you are not a regular in art galleries. I suggest you get a ticket from the Tobacconists in the shopping centre that you go through to get to the Louvre entrance Rue de Rivoli from the Palais Royal - Musée du Louvre metro station.(or the machines in the same shopping centre.) This entrance is not as busy as the main pyramid entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, well located, quiet”
Reviews.Author: edwie
Reviews.Content: Some people might think twice before booking this hotel because it's exactly next to Gare Montparnasse -the train station- thinking it might be noisy-. But wrong! This hotel is as quiet as they come. It seems to be a big hit with families, the week I stayed there, there were a bunch of American teenagers prancing around. The room was big, clean and luminous, it comes with a mini-bar, coffee machine and desk. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for business though... Internet is VERY expensive (20 EUR a day) and there are no other active wi fi connections around. For a vacation, it's ideal. If you love being online after returning from sightseeing, it's best to get a hotel which offers Wi Fi with the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly to recommend”
Reviews.Author: websteven
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this lovely hotel. The checkin was excellent. I asked for a balcony room and there was 1 available for a small extra fee. We had a nice view to the eiffel tower. The rooms are clean and modern. We didn't go for the inhouse breakfast but took it outside in some of the brasserias - but you''ll not always get a lot to choose from because in france it is not so common to get a big breakfast because they are used to get a huge lunch or dinner instead. I recommend some of the brasserias on the way to the trainstation or directly at gare montparnasse. Even after the hotel there was a nice restaurant (croque madame was the meal name - very famous in france). The public transport system is very good. On every corner a metro station. We took also the taxi sometimes. But we advice you to keep small money in your wallet. They never could give back money on a 50 euro bank note. The taxi drivers even often don't know common routes or they wanted to cheat on us. If you call a taxi by phone or on the reception they charge you also the way to the pick up place (in our case 7 euro). All in all we were very satisfied to stay in that hotel. The bed was very good - even the safe helped us a lot. If you stay in a room with balcony (7th floor) you have free internet access too instead of 20 euro / day - you can use internet near the reception desk for free on a mac computer but as we have seen it was never available due to other users. The staff is very friendly and communication in english was never a problem. If you want to make some tours or have any questions they will give you information materials at the reception desk. For our next trip we will stay here again because there was really nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel - clean, friendly, and terrific location”
Reviews.Author: rolandws
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us stayed in this hotel one evening while passing thru Paris on our way to Provence. The hotel was easy to reach from DeGaulle airport via the Air France bus and a short walk once we arrived downtown. Although we arrived at 11 AM, our rooms were ready for us. (I expected we would need to check our bags for a later check-in but that was not the case.) The rooms were smallish by American standards, but typical compared to other European hotels I have visited. The rooms were clean, and the bathrooms were very nice. We booked our rooms with the breakfast package and that worked out well.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: daburger
Reviews.Content: I stay in Paris regularly on business and have also travelled many times for leisure. This hotel is by far the best I've stayed in for the price. There will be better, but for a much higher rate. The Asparagus Soup was a delight, Vegetarian Lasange perfect, and the view from the room of the Eiffel Tower and the balcony a joy. Everything in the room worked, the bed comfortable and soft. The only fault I could find was the shaver socket too high for my electronic toothbrush charger! I'm staying there again next week and this time I'll be sure to check out the leisure facilities!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Novotel Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: Vodaboy
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a long weekend with my wife staying at this hotel,I have to say it was really good just like other reviewers nothing but postive things to say about the location,rooms,facilities and staff.I had some of the best quality sleep at this hotel,it's off the beaten track a little and this helped with the noise levels.The room was very clean and modern.The breakfast was good,although I didn't try the cooked option as I made the most of the wonderful pastries instead,so there you go don't hesitate to consider this hotel if you want a enjoyable and quiet stay in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alvacata
Reviews.Content: We booked the really early prepaid fare with breakfast included. It was a great deal. We had two rooms because we have two older teens. They gave us two rooms that connected. The rooms were clean and comfortable. There is a safe in each room that is quite large. We were able to keep all our valuables and an apple laptop in the safe. We felt very safe and secure in the neighborhood even when we returned late at night to the hotel. The metro stop could have been closer, it was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Breakfast consisted of croissants (really good), chocolate croissants, other pastries, different breads, toast, bacon, eggs, sausage, cereals, fruit (fresh and dried), applesauce, juices, yogurts, coffee, tea. I probably forgot something but there was quite a variety. I would definitely stay at this hotel again at the same rates. We loved the metro system in Paris and used it to get everywhere at all times of the day or night. By the time we left we were pros at it!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, roomy - great for family travel”
Reviews.Author: AmyinTally
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3-year old, and I stayed here for 4 nights in early June. The room is spacious by European standards with a pull-out sofa for 2. We stayed in an even-numbered room on the 8th floor, which our son loved because we had a great view of the Montparnasse train station across the way (because they are electric, they are very quiet). This also is convenient because 4 Metro lines are accessed at the station (after a 10-15 minute walk through the station) - a plus during those rainy Paris days. There also are great "fast food" bakeries (similar to Panera and Au bon Pain in th US but much tastier) at the train station for a quick and relatively inexpensive breakfast or lunch. Only a few stops (about 10 minutes) to the Eiffel Tower Metro station. From the common area by the elevators on the 8th floor, you can see the top portion of the Eiffel Tower (I'm guessing there also is a similar view for the higher odd-numbered rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: jus_rub
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during our Spring Break and very happy with it. From the previous review, we learned that we had to walk a long tunnel with stairs in the Montparnasse station. And we thought it wouldn't be a good idea with suitcases, stroller and kids. That's the reason why we chose to use taxi instead of RER. Round trips taxi to the hotel from the airport cost us 109 euro. Apart from that, we always used metro everywhere. And it's very convenient because the metro station is just around the corner. To exit Montparnasse station to the hotel, take Port Oceano direction, then follow Montparnasse 3 Vaugirard. And the hotel is just on your left. The room itself was spotless clean. It had a king size bed and a double sofa bed, a small bathroom with shower and bath tub, and a separate toilet. The hotel also provided a small refrigerator for us to keep our food fresh, a bottle of Evian daily, teas and coffees. One thing that I thought very smart was the plastic cups. Instead of providing ceramics cups, they provided us plastic cups and plastic spoons ( all wrapped in sealed plastic bags ) for our teas and coffees. I like it a lot. Because, with that I dont have to worry if the housekeeping ladies clean our cups properly or not. They changed the used cups and spoons, and replaced it with new ones. The environment around the hotel was also very nice and friendly. A lot of restaurants, cafes, atms and a supermarket. Overall, I think this is really a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: MAE05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel Paris Gare Montparnasse with my husband and our 3 year old on Friday, April 24 until Sunday, April 26, 2009. On the hotel’s website, got a great weekend rate of 125 Euros a night including breakfast buffet and a late checkout on Sunday. The room was just like the pictures shown on the hotel’s website. The room was very clean. The carpet was stained in the entryway to the room and there was a little mold in the shower, but the room really was clean and the bed and sofa bed were very comfortable. The toilet was in its own small room. In the bathroom, there was a sink, a shower and a separate bath tub. There were 2 or 3 pay for view children’s movies available on television. On regular televison, there were 3 or 4 children’s channels, mainly in French. The sofa bed was almost as big as the regular bed I shared with my husband, perfect for 2 children. We all slept great and never heard any noises from outside our room. Before a long day of sightseeing with a 3 year old, it was important for us to start the morning off with breakfast without having to leave the hotel. The buffet breakfast included in our room rate was good and our picky 3 year old enjoyed it. We arrived in Paris by train at the Gare de L’est station. Took the line 4 metro to Montparnasse Bienvenue station. Before our trip, I got the directions to take the back exit in the metro station to our hotel. It was a mistake to do on our first day. When cutting through the large metro station there are many stairs and it is quite a hike with a small child, travel stroller and luggage. I recommend following the exit signs and then find the way to the hotel at street level and enjoy seeing some of the Montparnasse area as you walk to the hotel. Also metro line 6 Pasteur station was nearby. Enjoyed line 6 because it is elevated, so you are outside instead of underground most of the time. Line 6 will also take you to the Eiffel tower. We used the metro a lot during our weekend trip, it was easy to use. Be aware that I didn’t see an elevator at many of the metro stations. The hotel was perfect for our needs for our first trip to Paris. We will definitely consider staying here again. We also really enjoyed the Montparnasse area and there was a large selection of restaurants near and on the Boulevard du Montparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good”
Reviews.Author: olivernone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in mid March '09 & I have to say that this hotel is a little gem, the staff were fantastic in every way, they also gave our two kids a soft toy each when we were checking in which was a nice touch, a perfect location for exploring the beautiful but very expensive city of Paris & we would certainly reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Paschalis
Reviews.Content: We've been there with my wife and our two daughters for three nights. As soon as we arrived they gave to our daughters two nice dolls, and they gave us immediately our room (a problem with the cards that are used to operate the elevator and open the room door was solved immediately). There was a security guard all the time inside the hotel. the room was very clean and nice. It had a seperate toilet and bathroom, and the bathroom had both a bathtab and a shower, also equipment for coffee and tea, safe and refrigirator with a free bottle of water everyday (which cost 3 euros in Paris). The breakfast was nice but it costed 16,00 euro per adult while for the kids it is free (if at least one adult pay for breakfast). The location of the hotel is great. The area is silent and nice. The metro stations are 5 minutes walk far (Pasteur and Montparnasse Bienvenue), while right behind the back door of the hotel you get the train (sncf) to Versailles. In the area you will find brasseiries, pizza, supermarket (5 minutes away). If you can walk, tour eiffel is about 20 minutes walk. The people in the hotel booked for us a taxi which took us to Orly airport, at 4:00am and costed 35,00euro. In general this is a hotel which gave us a sensation of luxury, it was safe, in a nice area, suitable for all needs.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings. Great Hotel but a contrangedor event.”
Reviews.Author: rankfussa
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in this hotel. I made the reservation by internet, and used the rate Early Breaks (with breakfest included). Payment immediate on internet with my Credit Card. A hotel Employee, reported that only two nights was paid. And the other two were not paid, and I have to complete the payment. But I made full payment of the four day advance on my credit card. They have not located my payments, and insisted that I had not made the payment, or a problem with my credit card. Luckily, I had in hand the bill of my credit card payments which were all demonstrated, and showed the hotel employee. He made a copy of the document and sent for review, and later then announced that I was actually right, that everything was paid. It was very embarrassing, and I was embarrassed about the situation. Also, every day, the key to the door (Door Card Key) not working. I had to come back to reception validate the card again. It was very uncomfortable. Every day. I never come back to this hotel again. Never more. The hotel is great, but these events make me stay away this hotel. About Novotel Montparnasse: The charge is resonable with the hotel. Breakfast is very good and generous, but cost is high. Parking is inside the Hotel. Very Safe. Nice location, residential area, but metro is not much close from hotel. Have a Pasteur Station and Gare Montparnasse Station. Short walk. Very good cleaning of the room. Staff speak English fluently. If I had not any problems, it would be a very good. I will look for another hotel the same level next time. I tried to separate my comments about the hotel, and about my stay. I tried to be impartial. The Hotel is great, but I don't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Paris”
Reviews.Author: johnny-glen
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff at reception who spoke English but were appreciative of our school style French. The room was lovely and clean and spacious with a view of the eiffel tower in the distance. Breakfast was a self service buffet and the continental was the better choice. Eat as much as you like, fresh croissants and pastries, yoghurts and fresh fruits. Excellent. There is a small restaurant at the hotel but we did not use it, opting for the paris cafe scene instead. We stayed on Valentines day, and the hotel left a complementary rose on the bed. A nice touch. All staff were helpful and polite. Quiet location despite being in City Centre, and convenient for the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracymcgreevy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in mid april 2008. It is a lovely, clean hotel. Staff are very helpful. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The hotel in just 5 mins walk from the metro system which we used daily.

Reviews.Title: “great option”
Reviews.Author: Pataruco
Reviews.Content: well located, one block from the gare montparnasse train station, and two blocks from galeries lafayette montparnasse, great breakfast, incredible attention, the rooms were a little too small, but we managed to stay with our two kids, (extremely hard to find in paris)

Reviews.Title: “Aweful square pillows”
Reviews.Author: JJHL
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean and well maintained in a quiet neighborhood and close to Montparnasse Station. However, you have to cut across the huge station or walk around it to get to the shops and restaurants. Better for those on business or want a quiet retreat. The bed is comfortable but what is very strange are the square pillows which are ok for kids but very uncomfortable for adults. These are OK as cushions but entirely inappropriate for a business class hotel. The shower and amenities are good and there is a nice flatscreen TV with CNN, BBC and movies on demand. The wireless broadband is fast but expensive. The breakfast is good and the reception staff are very polite, responsive and speak good English. Overall, ok but if comfortable pillows are important, this may not be your first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel for stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: catie2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for long weekend. We had a good size family room, very clean, high standard room with good bathroom, toiletries, tea making facilities and fridge. We found it to be very good value for a family room in Paris. The location is good, in a quiet residential street close to Montparnasse station. If you arrive by Eurostar you can get the metro line 4 direct to Montparnasse from Gare du Nord. There is a lively theatre area very close by with some good value places to eat as well as more expensive brasseries. The metro is nearby, but we mostly used buses, which take you to the main tourist areas, and are easy to work out with clear information about routes, stops and times at every stop. You can get books of tickets from the machine in the metro station which can be used for both. The hotel service and staff were fine, except the breakfast on Sunday was dire, everyone arrived at once so we had to queue to be seated, all tables were full, and we had to queue for bread, toast and juice. They did knock it off the bill when we complained. Also beware of the drinks prices in the bar. We managed to spend about £60 over three nights on a couple of drinks each.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant Stay - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa0206
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during the first leg of our honeymoon. The hotel is generally very nice - modern furniture and a rather contemporary look and feel. Upon check-in, the staff was very courteous and professional. We arrived shortly before the noon check-in, but were not allowed to check-in early. We were, however, allowed to leave our luggage in the locked side office until our room was ready, so we used the time to walk around the neighborhood and get acquainted with what was nearby (which is A LOT in terms of coffee shops, restaurants, and the mall - which is one of the 'Gallerie Lafayette' shopping centers). When we did check-in, we were given a room on the second floor which was pleasantly clean and presentable. Linens were plentiful and we were generally overall happy with the accomodation. Interestingly, the room had two separate bathroom areas. The first was the actual toilet room, which was immediately to the right upon entering the hotel room. The other, the bathing room (equipped with full shower, sink, and tub) was in the general vacinity of the bedroom area. Although we are not traditionally accustomed to this set-up, we assumed it to be characteristic of the hotels in Paris. Compared to other hotel room stays, we found the room to be on the smaller end in size, so the separation of the two bathroom areas was not all too bothersome. Our only negative observation - which we had read about in another review - was that the shower door did not close properly. It appeared as if it had not been properly installed. It was difficult to close at times and it leaked water out onto the bathroom floor. We did not dine in the hotel restaurant, but we did frequent the bar area and were pleased with the drink selection as well as the late-night appetizer/tapas menu. The bar staff was courteous and the environment friendly. We did have breakfast in the restaurant area on our second day; however, we did not particularly care for our experience or the selection of food. In researching our stay at this hotel, we were aware that many of the guests are on business-related trips, as the hotel is in a financial/business district. As such, most of the quests staying at the hotel were on business, but we did find other guests traveling on vacation, as well as families with small children. In any case, upon coming down for breakfast on the second morning, we waited in line as the maitre d' seated guests in the restaurant area. Our turn came up in line, but rather than seating us, the maitre d' turned to a number of guests to our right and sat them beforehand. These folks were clearly dressed in business attire whereas my husband and I were more dressed down. I mentioned to the maitre d' that I didn't think it was very courteous of him to have seated others before us when we had clearly been waiting in line. He said he understood my concern, but then added that there was no need to make an issue of it. I thought otherwise, and later mentioned the incident at the front desk. The receptionist was very understanding and apologetic and offered to remove the charges for breakfast. She even made a point to say that the hotel treats all guests the same, whether they are on business or not. As for the breakfast, we were not entirely impressed with the selection and would highly recommend stopping at one of the many creperies or coffee shops in Paris as the selection tends to be plentiful and more characteristic of Paris. Lastly worth mentioning is that, one of the best features of this hotel is that it is located right next to the Gare Montparnesse which has easy train and metro access. Literally, almost every metro line can be picked up here. We were comforted in knowing how easy it was to travel about Paris and how accessible we were to this main hub. It definitely gave us a good feeling in knowing that we could get anywhere we needed to go in the city, without having to be directly in the center of Paris. If we were to return to Paris, we would highly consider staying at this hotel again. The accomodations were pleasing and the location was very convenient. If you are looking to stay here, we recommend booking directly through the Novotel's website. There are several promotions (City Breaks, Early Booking) which apply to certain Novotel hotels - we booked early, but under a no change, no cancellation promotion - and were able to get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about the Novotel Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: IDACheshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, together with our 2 year old daughter, stayed at this hotel on two seperate occasions each of one night in late September and early October (on the way to and from a holiday in the south of France). I booked the hotel via their website and ordered a cot for our daughter. My booking this hotel was based on reading good reviews from other visitors. On arrival our impressions were mixed. The location is reasonable, but even though it is close to the departure end of Montparnasse SNCF station, the metro is a very lengthy 20 minute walk from the hotel through a packed station. Also, it is not on the RER line so travel across Paris to Gare du Nord can take about half an hour, not including the walk from hotel to metro. The receptionist was very much the pushy salesman, buttering us up by offering our daughter a cuddly toy and then giving her two (even though he gave two to every child!), then pushing their loyalty card on us with a big sales pitch about it all. It took ages to just check in and get to our room when we were all very tired. On both occasions there was no cot in the room and none forthcoming when asked, despite having booked this in advance. The website gave the impression that the hotel was very child friendly and that there was a play area in the hotel for young children, however, there was no such play area. The room was small with not that much storage space for clothes, but luckily we were only staying one night. We were told on the website that there was unlimited tea and coffee, but found in the room just one sachet of coffee and one very small sachet of milk, not even enough for one person to have one drink! Also, the cups were two of the most revolting plastic containers I've ever seen; I didn't even realise they were cups at first! Not what one expects from this class of hotel, especially as staying in a Mercure (supposedly a lower class of hotel) in Calais the night before we had a lot of coffee sachets and very nice real mugs. The Novotel also had no minibar, just a small bottle of water in the fridge. There was WIFI in the room but a payable service. There was a terminal in the lobby that was free to use for twenty minutes at a time. The one good thing about the hotel was the breakfast, which was varied, with cereals, fruit, cold meat, bacon, eggs and sausage etc., although no better than any other hotel we've stayed in. It did cost 16 euros each though! All in all we were not that impressed and won't stay there again, or in a Novotel. It just wasn't up to the standards one would expect from that class of hotel charging the high rate we paid for each night. There are also better located hotels nearer the RER lines as well as the metro if you want to enjoy Paris and get round quickly. The location was fine for us as we were travelling from Montparnasse SNCF station the next morning. All in all, mixed feelings and not as great for families as other reviews make out.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel in paris, VERY pleased”
Reviews.Author: Louietheroux2
Reviews.Content: We had a really SUPER stay at this hotel recently whilst in paris, Booking in advance saved us money (if you pre pay then it gives you terms and conditions, if you don't like them then don't book in this way....another reviewer says not to do this but it's your choice at the end of the day, we had no problem), it is VERY clean and modern, the staff speak excellent english and even gave our kids complimentary cuddly toys which they were obviously pleased at, a really nice touch. The room was lovely and the kids fold out beds were ideal for them as they're just kids and that's what they're designed for, there was a mini fridge and safe and TV / internet etc. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment but it's location is a 20 min walk to the eiffel tower which can be seen from 50yds from the hotel, the GARE MONTPARNASSE (Main railway station)and metro is about 100 metres away unless you choose PASTEUR metro stop which is a 5 to 10 min stroll which is fine for kids too. We really had no complaint at all with this hotel. They even allowed late check out without any quibble and we'd definetly stay again if we needed to visit paris again. The only minor thing I could pick them up on is we gave them 3 bits of luggage and only received 1 tag which I questioned, when returning our luggage was all still there so no problems but i suppose it could of been had a bag disappeared, however, that said if that's all I can complain about then I'm happy !!!, this was a really nice find in paris. If you like modern hotels then you'll love it, if not then look for an old hotel, we'd definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - Applause!”
Reviews.Author: justchill3n
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for Christmas and New Years! We didn't come to realize until the second day that the location is in fact very close to one of the HUB train stations. Cool! The hotel alone has a modern ambiance to it. The lobby is a bit basic though functional. They even have luggage storage for those checking in way too early like we did. The room was really nice. It was very clean, equipped with all necessities any vacationer would ask for (i.e. TV, Refrigerator, Closet, etc..) . More than we expected really! My wife even loved it! The bathroom was awesome. We had a huge bed which was not expected considering we were in Paris...again, *applause* In comparisson to other hotels within the vicinity, this one is competitively priced. I give an A++ for cleanliness no doubt. The location puts you in a quiet area but yet easily accessible. It's in the mid-point of almost all spots you would want to see when you're in Paris. Like almost everything else there, you'll need to exercise your legs since you'll be walking alot. Familiarize yourself with the map and you'll see. There was one female staff member who was not as friendly as the others but I guess it was due to being in the night shift. Anywayz, I'm not letting this one turn me down since overall, we had a marvelous experience in Paris. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: OntarioMike8
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 1 child) stayed at this hotel btw 14th and 19th July. Location is very good and easy to go to Metro with a 10 minute walk (either on the street or in the back end adjacent to hotel). Room is small (we knew about it after reading thru reviews here) as expected but is clean. It meets our budget & expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: LJH_Staffs
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here. My husband and I arrived late afternoon and we were just about to ask if any rooms had a view of the Eiffel Tower when the receptionist said he was looking for a room with a view for us. We were given a room on the 7th floor and had not only a great view of the Eiffel Tower, but also our own private balcony (only available on 7th floor rooms). We'd also managed to arrive on Bastille Day so we enjoyed a wonderful firework display that night from the comfort of our own balcony. The room was appointed well - just enough storage space for 2. The bathroom had a walk in shower - no bath, but that wasn't a problem. The shower pressure was good with the usual toiletries (shampoo, body lotion, body wash). The bed was comfortable but as seems to be usual practice in some European hotels, the pillows were rubbish!! We managed to get a good early rate deal from Novotel's website for this trip which included breakfast. There was a selection of hot and cold self serve buffet food, but I don't think it warranted the individual breakfast price for those who wish to pay extra. The location was good - very quiet. After a couple of days we figured out which railway station exit to use - head for the Port Oceane exit followed by the signs for Vaugirard 3 - this exit brings you out 50 yards from the hotel. Alternatively, the elusive 'back way' from the railway station at Vaugirard opens directly onto the back door of the hotel - great if you can find it. Overall this hotel was very good - would definitely stay here again. Even more worth it if you can get a good deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Experience”
Reviews.Author: autolineRecife
Reviews.Content: Is is a brand new hotel, very modern and clean. The room was very small for 2 adults and 2 children. We had some problems : 1) The hotel is very far from the metro station. It takes about 15 minutes. My children (age 6 and 8) got really tired walking. 2) Novotel is a family friendly hotel but the employee at the reception was very rude to my kids. 3) The food was really bad, I had a chicken sandwich and felt sick, I could not sleep the whole night. 4) The cleaning lady got very mad when we left the room late. She knocked at the door and started screaming. 5) I asked for a taxi on the last day and the recepcionist made a mistake and I almost lost my flight to England. I went back to the recepcion for help and he was really unpolite. 6) They charged us breakfast for the 7 days we spent there. I had to ask to remove it from the bill. I saw other guests complaining about that too.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff- excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Smurflover
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel through Eurostar. Excellent location, but Montparnasse station has many entrances so make sure you find the easiest one to exit aim for BD de Vaugirard or pasteur station. There is also an exit out the back of the station but i could never find it. The room was large with airconditioning, fridge, shower and bath. The staff were friendly and very helpful. There is also a baggage store if you need it. The Hotel is located next to Tour Montparnasse which is a must do!!! especially at night. last admission around 11pm. overall: An excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: norasafi
Reviews.Content: very very clean hotel and very nice location

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean.”
Reviews.Author: labradorheat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was near Gare Montparnasse. There were 60 kids in a school band and they were in and out of the elevators all day. A few times, the elevator was blocked and they would ride up and down. While they were reasonably quiet, their last night, they knocked on doors and called rooms to say goodbye. Nice idea but not after midnight. Food was expensive. Most important, the hotel was clean. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Security Issue.”
Reviews.Author: DollyRak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed four nights at Novotel Paris Gare Montparnasse. We arrived in from CDG and were advised by the hotel to take the Air France shuttle which cost 15Euro per person single journey to Montparnasse Gare. The walk from the bus stop to the hotel was an easy stroll of 10 minutes. We arrived at the hotel at 11am and the receptionist was very helpful and we were checked into our room straight away. The hotel is modern but basic and we were pleasantly surprised with the size of our room and bathroom, although there was very little wardrope space, it was prefectly exceptable. We did not hear any noise from our neighbours and the airconditioning was adequate as were the tea and coffee making facitlies and small fridge. Our only compaint was that on our last day we returned to our hotel room to discover that our room had been searched, although nothing had been taken. We reported this to the hotel manger who informed us that it was hotel policy to do random searches by the security officer. This did spoil our stay and we wouldnt stay at the Novotel again only because of this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and modern”
Reviews.Author: Paz_e_Bem
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel (2 adults 1 child). It is quite modern (opened in 2006), very clean, rooms are the usual novotel style, located a 100 meters away from the "Gare du Montparnasse, where you get the Subway, buses, taxis ... Breackfast is a bit crowdy, but if you get there around 8 am you will have no problem at all. There's a small but friendly fitness room with 4 "machines" at the 7th floor. The hotel is really safe, they have permanent staff around just to assure everything is fine. Staff very friendly and efficient. If you book through accor.com 4 or 5 monthes in advance, you get a 99 Euro rate with breackfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Cute but not perfect - but recommended !”
Reviews.Author: ErosSlovenija
Reviews.Content: Well, as always Novotel prooved to be family friendly facility worldwide, also in Paris. Location is about 500 meters from nearest Pasteur Metro station and about 700 to Gare the Montparnasse, huge railway and Underground station, where you need some time to accomodate and oriented. Therefore location of hotel is cute, however not that close to public transport. But it is the same with all the stuff in Paris, huge distances, so this "500 m" only will not bother you the second or the third day of your stay. Good things about hotel : suitable price for good amenities (also noticed lots of air crew stay there), location, peacefull area, relatively close to public transport. Not that good things about the hotel : price and what you can get for breakfast (quite poor choices), waiting ques for breakfast (yet you wait in que pretty much for everything in Paris),a bit clumsy waiters, not skillfull stuff at the reception desk regarding some advices (2 out of 3 were misleading). Do not miss : taking a underground to anywhere, great ! Overall : Were staying already in better facilities, but this was just fine. Overall : I would recommend it to all families. (we were 2 adults and two children age 10 and 15)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience While Visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: WeLiKe2TrAvElToo
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at the Novotel for one week during our first visit to Paris. We arrived just afternoon & our spacious,clean room was ready. The staff was friendly & helpful during our entire stay. This contemporary hotel is in a good location in Paris near the metro station & many shops & restaurants. The La Scadura restaurant just around the corner was a great place to dine. The many places to eat & sight see around the Monparnasse are within walking distance. The Eiffel Tours can be seen clearly after walking out of the hotel & standing on the corner of Pasteur street. (Wow....what a view). Staying at the Novotel Paris Gare Montparnasse provided a great experience for our week vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price - but overrated”
Reviews.Author: VfB 1893
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Novotel middle of March and were positively surprised by the well accessible location. You can easily use the Metro system to reach this hotel. The lobby makes a futuristic impression, but is not the most comfortable place to sit around. Reception and check-in were good, and staff was honestly always friendly. The room we had on the fifth floor had a view towards the Montparnasse Tower and was well sound-proofed. I did not appreciate mildew in the bathroom, as well as a dainky look of the chair and carpet. The next day things looked a little better, as house keeping touched up a little. Although the room looks futuristic it simply was to too small for me and my wife - especially the bath room which lead to a regular fight with splashes of water mounting into a puddle. The bed was ok, a bit too soft, but linen was changed daily - so no complaints after all. BREAKFAST was a real dissapointment! The selection is rather basic and lacks of fresh fruit and vegetables. You find croissants, white bread, eggs, bacon, sausages, youghurts, ham and cheese. Nothing really for the "organic-lover". The breakfast room was messy and slightly chaotic. And this is the main reason why we will not stay at this hotel again, although we got a quite good deal (120 Euros per night - which is cheap for Paris). However, we will spend a little more money next time, for a four star hotel. This one is strong 3 star hotel and targets families.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Im_Harsh_But_Fair
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in February 2008. This hotel is modern, comfortable and clean. I am the sort of person who is extremely fussy about having things clean and hygenic and I was amazed that I was really happy with our hotel room. The room was a very good size - lots of room to walk around. The bathroom had a bath and separate shower - both of which worked very well and were clean. The maids that tidied the rooms did their job brilliantly. The hotel is about 3 minutes walk away from Pasteur metro station. The only bad thing about this restaurant was the hotel restaurant. I would have to say that I have never eaten anything so disgusting in my life. I would never eat there again. For food, we found it better to eat a lot a lunchtime and just buy baguettes and pastries for dinner - but that's just me. I would recommend a cafe called 'Le 234 Tuilleries' near Tuilleries metro. The service and food was excellent. One thing to bear in mind ... the rooms use the two-pin plugs (but not the standard ones that you can buy in the UK - the plug sockets have holes for two pins and a bit that sticks out and locks into the plug itself). You can borrow a plug from reception but they charge you 20 euros for every use. All in all, a brilliant place to stay, and I hope other hotels can live up to this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel! Should be a 4*”
Reviews.Author: purple_sweetie1
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Great Location and great staff. The hotel staff always greated us with a smile! The maid service was very good and our room was cleaned everyday. We used the metro system to get around Paris and would advise using www.allo-france.com to buy metro tickets before hand. The two day passes are brillaint for unlimited travel on the metro, RER and buses. There are lots of shops about 5 mins away. After walking around Paris all day it was nice to come back to our comfortable hotel to relax. Our room had just a shower, which was fine by us and had lots of room. This is a great 3* hotel , it should be a 4*!! We didnt ever eat in the hotel so we cant comment but there is a restaurant and a bar there also. This hotel is also right by the Montparnasse tower and the Eiffel Tower can also been seen a few streets away! Which is lovely whe lit up! Hope this helps!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Slick”
Reviews.Author: aj_chopra
Reviews.Content: Coviniently located next to the Monparnasse tube station, the hotel has very slick and mordern rooms equipped with a TV through which you can surf the net and see pay per view ... nice comfortable beds and a nice bathroom with lots of stuff ... Slightly on the expensive side though. If u walk down a few steps from the hotel towards the main street, u can see the eiffel tower on your left :)

Reviews.Title: “Good novotel”
Reviews.Author: UKDunc
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, pretty standard novotel property (which in my experience are usually good). The location is good for getting around with a couple of metro stops nearby. We booked directly through the novotel website where they have good deals if you book in advance. We flew into Charles de Gaulle and caught the air france bus to nearby montparnasse train station which saved a bundle of csh compred to getting a taxi and was much less hassle than going on the metro with suitcases!! There's info on this in the forums on this site. For a special meal I'd recommend a visiting ciel de paris which is on the 56th floor of the montparnasse tower, and provides spectacular views of the city, particularly the eiffel tower. Not a cheap meal by any means but a great experience! This is in walking distance of the hotel. Alternativel you can just go to the bar in the restaurant for a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Familly weekend”
Reviews.Author: travelbugAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: My husband, step-daughter and I just came back from a 2 night stay at the Novotel Montparnasse. We stayed at a superior room, booked directly through the hotel website. We had a very enjoyable stay. The hotel is well located, close to metro and train station and walking distance to main attractions. The room is big enough one king size bed and 1 sofa bed that has room for two. Small bathroom with shower and bath, and separate toilet. All you need is there. Breakfast was included, very varied, everything for everyione. Staff at reception very helpful, good tips for eating out. Just a nice, clean and well located hotel at a very good price. Eating in for dinner is actually expensive for what you get, but it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Standard”
Reviews.Author: Amaware
Reviews.Content: Near the Gare Montparnasse rail station (only a bit difficult to find your way back, because the station is quite big!). The room are clean and friendly, but all in all is a standard city business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superbe!!!”
Reviews.Author: TripAimer
Reviews.Content: My daughter, my wife and I stayed at Novotel for 6 nights and I could not wait to writte my comments on the web. Location: Near La Gare montparnasse which is a main train station and in a quiet street (very peacefull). Accomodation: Very clean, with a new design and spacious. Personnel: Friendly. I even called one of them ''Man of solution'' since was there every time I needed some helps or information. Facilities: Parking very well protected with a good rate for a long stay. Restaurant: We went to the restaurant once and were suprised that it was cheaper (main course + desert) than some restaurants in the area. Rate: I booked the reservation via the web and for all the pleasure I had to stay there, I would say that the price was reasonnable. However it was christmas Period and Paris is empty (people go to la ''Campagne'') and hotel prices are decreased.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: alpal1000
Reviews.Content: Well appointed room with great furnishings and delightful attentive and helpful staff. Location was wonderful, close to Metro, RER and SNCF trains, great shopping in malls and traditional streets, We found some great cafes in the area, too! Travelled with children, the room was set up well for our 2 kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but overhyped”
Reviews.Author: rosses
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, but a lot of the reviews here are over the top. Aside from the bathroom, I could see little reason for the extreme excitement in some of the posts. There are definitely better located hotels in Paris for around the same price. Most things were good - staff efficient, if a little bit unenthusiastic. Room service meal was ok. Cleanliness was good, but walls in my room were a bit scuffed. Generally a hassle free stay, if not quite the Nirvana suggested by some reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel Good value Near Trains”
Reviews.Author: weezee42
Reviews.Content: Easy to walk to trains or metros, friendly staff, would stay here again.
